title: BUSINESS
description: Washington

title: Science Library
description: Nowhere in manmade structures is there such geometric diversity as in nature. Identical snowflakes have never been found. They seem to occur in an infinite variety of sixsided forms. The tiny sea creatures known as radiolarians are built on skeletons in an almost unlimited variety of spherical structures. At least 4,000 species are known. Such diversity occurs, on an even tinier scale, in many viruses.

title: MALE REGISTRATION FOR A DRAFT GAINS
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  A House panel today approved a measure that would require 18yearold males to register for a possible draft, a move strongly criticized by opponents of conscription.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Michael Mikolayunas, U.C.L.A. Football Aide
description: LOS ANGELES, April 30  Michael Mikolayunas Jr., an assistant football coach at the University of California, Los Angeles, and former assistant at West Point, died on Friday of an apparent heart attack at his home. He was 30 years old.

title: ERIC ERICSON
description: Eric Ericson, a physicalculture instructor at the New York Athletic Club since 1945, died yesterday in his room at the club on Central Park South where he had lived for the last 34 years. He was 99 years old.

title: Prices Paid To Farmers Decline 1%
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) Prices that farmers get for raw products dropped 1 percent in April, the first decline in the monthly index since last November, the Agriculture Department said today. But despite the drop, farm prices were 17 percent higher than they were a year ago, officials said.

title: Guild Committee Backs Accord With The Times
description: A new threeyear contract agreement between the Newspaper Guild of New York and The New York Times was unanimously approved yesterday by the negotiating committee of the guild unit at The Times.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, April 30, 1979

title: Quarterback Best
description: The Giants, trying to keep a secret everyone in the National Football League knows except perhaps the Giants themselves, are interested in Jack Thompson, who says it's weird that more people know me as the Throwin Samoan than by my real name.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: A new legal team is working for the Eastman Kodak Company in its uphill fight against a civil antitrust suit brought against it by Berkey Photo Inc. The man leading this team as the case makes its way through the appeals process is William Piel Jr., a pillar of the legal establishment.

title: Oil Platform Fire Hurts Workers
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 30 (AP)  Two oil field workers were in critical condition today after being burned in a fire on a Gulf of Mexico drilling platform manned by 55 persons, the authorities said. Six other workmen were injured when fire erupted on the outof,service Marathon Oil Company platform situated off the Louisiana coast, about seven miles west of Southwest Pass.

title: Court Won't Bar SchoolAid Budget
description: ALBANY, April 30  State Supreme Court Justice Daniel H. Prior has refused the request of 40 property poor districts to enjoin the state from putting into effect its $3.5 billion educationaid budget. But voicing concern for the children in those schools, he justice said the districts had sufficient legal standing to pursue their case against the state.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: WHEN you're in a Russell H. Greenan novel, the whole world is crazy. That's why you know from the very beginning of Keepers that it isn't only the inmate who is mad. In fact.

title: Corporations Report Their Sales and Earnings Results for the Quarter
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) The American Exchange and (0) Overftsetounter.

title: Arts Endowment Keeps Aides Past 5Year Limit
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  It is the prerogative of all new administrators to clean house. So when Livingston L. Biddle, chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, announced last year a new plan to limit the tenure of the agency's 13 program administrators to five years, he was not prepared for the resistance he met.

title: Third U.S.Soviet Talk in Vienna
description: VIENNA, April 30 (AP)  The third round of secret talks on the prohibition of killer satellites continued here between the United States and the Soviet Union, the United States Embassy said today.

title: High Court Delays 6 Cases to Fall
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  The Supreme Court announced today that it would carry over until next fall six cases that it had been scheduled to decide before the current term ends in June. The six cases, all of more than routine interest, were argued last month and will now be scheduled for reargrument in the fall.

title: German Car Makers Set Fuel Cut
description: BONN, April 30 West German car manufacturers agreed today to reduce fuel consumption of their autos by an average of 10 to 12 percent by 1985.

title: Market Place
description: SHAREHOLDERS of National Airlines are to decide at the company's annual meeting on May 16 whether to approve a merger of the Miamibased line with Pan American World Airways or Eastern Air Lines amid a continuing effort by Texas International Airlines Inc. to acquire National.

title: Edper Equities Buys Big Block of Brascan
description: TORONTO, April 30  Moving swiftly and secretly in its bid to force Brascan Ltd. to drop its takeover of the F.W. Woolworth Company, Edper Equities Ltd., an investment arm of the Bronfman family, bought 3.3 million shares of Brascan today.

title: Express Postal Service Blocked by U.S. Judge
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI)  A Federal judge has blocked the Postal Service from starting what it had hoped would be a big moneymaker  a Metro Express Service that would guarantee sameday delivery of intracity mailings.

title: New York Relief Found to Slight Hispanic Cases
description: Federal officials declared yesterday that New York City was discriminating against Hispanic welfare clients and applicants. They said there were inadequate numbers of Spanishspeaking staff and Spanishlanguage forms at welfare offices and delays in benefits for the poor.

title: Amtrak Fighting Move to Cut Service As Deadline for Congress to Act Nears
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  Amtrak, the national rail passenger system, which has a low rating from the Carter Administration, is beginning to fight back as a deadline nears in Congress for action on an Administration plan to slash its service.

title: Science Books for the Young Are Cited
description: The New York Academy of Sciences has named The Smallest Life Around Us, written by Lucia Anderson and illustrated by Leigh Grant. as last year's best science book for young readers.

title: Rangers 8, Royals 7
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., April 30 (AP) Richie Zisk keyed a fiverun rally in the third inning with a tworun single and made a diving catch in right field to end a Kansas City rally in the sixth as the Texas Rangers beat the Royals, 87, tonieht.

title: Takeover Stocks Up as Market Slips
description: Takeover stocks scored impressive gains yesterday as the market in.general , pulled back mildly, reflecting fears of escalating interest rates.

title: Mortgages Bought At 10.826% Figure
description: Mortgage interest rates rose again to a record high in the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation's weekly purchase of home loans yesterday.

title: Associated Press
description: CAIRO. April 30  An Israeli cargo ship sailed up the Suez Canal today in the first tangible result of the EgyptianIs raeli peace treaty.

title: President Meets With Ford
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI) President Carter talked with former President Gerald R. Ford at the White House today at a meeting that was not listed on Mr. Carter's public schedule. A White House spokesman said, They generally get together for a talk whenever Mr. Ford is in town.

title: The City
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan refused to block rent increases of up to 8.5 percent for about 300,000 rentstabilized apartments in the city.

title: Murdoch Company Gets Key Role In Running of Two State Lotteries
description: ALBANY, April 30  Leisure Systems Inc., a company controlled by K. Rupert Murdoch, the publisher of The New York Post, will assume a major interest tomorrow in the state's lotto and keno lottery operations.

title: LONGTERM VISION URGED BY KENNEDY
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy, in a speech in which he called President Carter's proposed windfall profits tax on oil company profits a transparent fig leaf, yesterday called for vigorous American leadership in the 1980's to prevent a time of reaction and desperation, of drift.

title: Deterring Poisonous Decisions
description: No wonder the public is so willing to be cynical about the nation's top leaders. Now two more cases have emerged in which Government officials and corporate managers knew that their activities were endangering the public  yet they issued no warnings and, in fact, suppressed knowledge of the danger. The nation needs a better way to encourage, or compel, more responsible behavior.

title: Mets, Behind Swan, Defeat Padres by 43
description: Was Manager Joe Torre of the Mets managing from the rightfield bull pen after being ejected from last night's contest at Shea Stadium or was he in his team's clubhouse listening to the game on the radio?

title: For ProAbortion Group, an Aggressive New Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  As hundreds of women sporting big yellow Choice buttons streamed through the halls of Congressional office buildings today, the National Abortion Rights Action League wound up a fourday national convention by lobbying legislators anti filing six complaints with the Federal Election Commission, alleging violations of Federal election laws by a number of antiabortion groups.

title: Khomeini Orders Iranian Regime
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 30 Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini today ordered the Provisional Revolutionary Government to sever diplomatic relations with Egypt.

title: MORRIS RITTENBERG
description: Morris Rittenberg, president of Domestic Enterprises for the National Broadcasting Company until his retirement in 1972, died Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 63 years old.

title: A Key to the Future for Ugandans: Restoring the Nation's Moral Fiber
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Rich in people, minerals, climate and the fertility of the soil, Uganda stands a far better chance. than most developing countries of rebounding from the eight years of terror, mismanagement, corruption and tribal favoritism under Idi Amin.

title: Spot Oil Prices Reported to Be Rising
description: Oil prices have increased once again on the open market, prompting fears that another general price increase may be on the way.

title: Charter in Pact to Buy Carey Energy and Get Mideast Crude Oil
description: The Charter Company disclosed yesterday that it had reached tentative agreement with Edward M. Carey the oil man, to buy the Carey Energy Corporation.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that a person cannot be unwillingly committed to a mental institution without clear and convincing evidence of being both mentally ill and likely to be dangerous

title: U.N. Condemns Rhodesian Vote and Urges Maintenance of Sanctions
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., April 30 The Security Council approved a resolution today condemning the recent Rhodesian elections as illegal and calling on governments to maintain United Nations sanctions against Rhodesia.

title: Chemistry of Pain Begins to Emerge
description: WHEN an American nurse, home after 10 years work with Eskimos in the Arctic, volunteered for tests of pain sensitivity in a research laboratory here, the results were astonishing.

title: Montreal Bank Purchase
description: MONTREAL, April 30 (AP) ߞ The Bank of Montreal said today that ft had completed in Frankfurt, West Germany, its previously announced agreement to acquire a 25.1 percent interest in the Algemeine Deutsche Credit Anstalt, a bank. The Canadian bank holds an option to purchase an additional 25 percent.

title: Expos 8, Dodgers 4
description: MONTREAL, April 30 (AP)  Steve Rogers pitched a sevenhitter and Gary Carter and Andre Dawson each cracked his sixth home run of the season today as the Montreal Expos extended their winning streak to six games with an 84 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: 2 Tennesseans Buy Esquire; To Continue Its Tradition
description: Esquire Magazine has been sold to two men from Knoxville, Tenn., who said yesterday that they would continue its tradition of literary excellence.

title: Moroz Describes Jail
description: JERSEY CITY, April 30 With his right leg twitching nervously, Valentyn Moroz described today how he survived 14 years in Soviet prisons for advocating Ukrainian independence. It was a time, he said, of forced feedings, beatings, solitary confinement for months in freezing cells and, finally, an attempt by the authorities to have him declared insane.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DIGS DATA Brooklyn's brownstone neighborhoods, home financing, building inspection, legal problems, architectural renovation and other topics of interest will be discussed at this month's home and coop buying workshops presented by the borough's Union Gas Company.

title: Hardie Gramatky, 72; Writer and Illustrator Of Little Toot Books
description: Hardie Gramatky, author of the Little Toot children's books, an illustrator and a highly regarded watercolorist, died of cancer Sunday at his home in Westport, Conn. He was 72 years old.

title: The Quiet Ones From California
description: LOUISVILLE, KY., April 30  Two weeks after Affirmed won last year's Kentucky Derby here, Gordon Campbell called Don Pierce into his tack room at Hollywood Park in California.

title: SENATOR NUNN SEES
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  Senator Sam Nunn, Democrat of Georgia, said today that unless the United States moved quickly to strengthen its nuclear and conventional armed forces, a new strategicarms treaty with Moscow would do little more than ratify an emeruinu Soviet military superiority.

title: Waldheim Sees Chinese Leaders on Vietnam Tension
description: PEKING. April 30  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations began talks with Chinese leaders today as part of his personal initiative to reduce tensions between Vietnam and China.

title: Music: Liszt's Rarely Heard Christus
description: THE Cathedral of St. John the Divine made a grandiose musical gesture Sunday afternoon in celebration of the massive Gothic structure's new rebuilding program: the first performance in the United States in 90 years of Liszt's oratorio Christus. Offered free, the event was attended by more than 4,000 people, many of whom had to stand from first note to last, more than three and a half hours. The last time New York heard this lengthy work  my musical will and testament, Liszt called it  was in 1889 when the Philharmonic performed it.

title: Theater: Loudspeaker
description: JOHN HOWARD LAWSON'S 1927 political farce, Loudspeaker, about a gubernatorial campaign in New York, now being revived at Shelter West, manages to touch all bases: the candidate's catering to ethnic minorities, his calculated deference to the press, the smokefilled planning sessions in back rooms, the gloss he puts on his family life though the reality is far different and his fear that youthful peccadilloes will rise to blast his hopes: all the banalities in fact that beset such a campaign.

title: TV: Fallout From Three Mile Island on CBS Reports
description: FALLOUT From Three Mile Island, the CBS Reports documentary scheduled for 8 o'clock this evening, surveys some of the ramifications  real and potential  of last month's accident at the Pennsylvania nuclear power facility. Despite the sensational nature of the event  the technical word used by nuclear advocates to describe an accident  the producers. Judy Crichton and George Crile, have assembled an essay dominated by pedestrian questionmarks.

title: Advertising
description: THE sixmonthold City and Regional Magazine Association, made up of 28 publishing companies, should have a sort of headquarters in New York in a month or so.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: CARTER SAYS CHARGE BY KENNEDY ON OIL IS LOT OF BALONEY
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  President Carter dismissed today as baloney a charge by Senator Edward M. Kennedy that the President's energy plan represented a surrender to the oil interests.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Bacallao Takes 11th Title
description: Pedro Bacallao of the Princeton Club was given a plaque commemorating his 10 consecutive National squash tennis singles championships on Sunday and afterward won his 11th title by defeating Bill Rubin of the Yale Club 158, 1510. 155. at the Yale Club.

title: Education Department Is Backed By Senate in a Victory for Carter
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The Carter Administration won a key victory today at the Senate voted to create a new department of education.

title: 2 Nuclear Agency Aides Tell of Fears of Meltdown at Crippled Plant
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  An official of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission testified today that if the utility company that owned a damaged Pennsylvania reactor had tried to use one conventional method to try to cool it early in the accident there would have been a fairly high possibility of a catastrophic core meltdown.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Music

title: Letters
description: Language by Computer

title: Indicators Off in March
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  A Government measure intended to predict future economic trends fell last month for the fourth time in five months, appearing to confirm the views of many economists that the economy is slowing and could slip into recession.

title: Diversifying Its Portfolio Has Paid Off
description: Foundations, with their limited endowments, are in many ways like retired people living on their savings while the price of everything around them soars.

title: For Ecuador, Populist Chief
description: QUITO, Ecuador. April 30  After such an overwhelming victory, a more flamboyant politician would have gone straight to the most prominent balcony in the most crowded city square. But candidate elected President of Ecuador by nearly 69 percent of those who voted yesterday, had another destination in the early hours of today: he went to television studios.

title: NEGLIGENCE IS CITED
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  John W. Gardner said today that while he was Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare he was never given the results of a Governmentfinanced study in 1965 showing a high rate of leukemia deaths among people exposed to lowlevel radiation during nuclear weapons tests in Nevada in the 1950's. He attributed the omission to a conscious act of negligence.

title: Twins 6, Blue Jays 3
description: TORONTO. April 30 (AP)  Butch Wynegar hit a tworun homer and a runscoring single to spark the Minnesota Twins to a 63 triumph over the Toronto Blue Jays.

title: Indonesia to Lift Oil Price
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, April 30 (AP)  Indonesia will increase the export price of its crude oil tomorrow, the rise ranging from 50 cents to $1 a barrel, it was announced today. A Government official said the export price of light crude would be raised from $17.35 to $18.35 a barrel and heavy crude from $15.65 to $16.15 a barrel.

title: About New York
description: When Miss Twombley's town house became a thrift shop 54 years ago, Ruben, the chauffeur, would use a roadster to pick up donations from elegant families, and young ladies of the Social Register would put in time as fantasy shopgirls, charitable and demure, at this new idea, called the Opportunity Shop.

title: A's 5, Red Sox 4
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 30 (UPI) Jeff Newman, whose ninthinning homer with two out tied the game, singled to drive in Mitchell Page from second base with two out in the bottom of the 11th tonight to give the Oakland A's a 54 triumph over the Boston Red Sox.

title: Astros 6, Cardinals 5
description: ST. LOUIS, April 30 (UPI)  Terry Puhl's tworun homer capped a fourrun ninth inning rally tonight that gave the Houston Astros a 65 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: High Court Bars a Tax, Averting a Trade War
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  A new kind of international trade war was averted today when the Supreme Court declared unconstitutional a property tax levied by two California cities on foreignowned cargo containers.

title: Carter Bid for New Aid to Turks Is Opposed in Senate Committee
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  President Carter's request for $150 million in emergency aid for Turkey encountered opposition in the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today because of Turkey's policies toward CVDCUS and Greece.

title: Dr. Thomas E. Tierney, 56, Dies; Was Psychologist in Manhattan
description: Dr. Thomas E. Tierney, a psychologist, died Thursday of cancer at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 56 years old and lived in Palisades, N.Y.

title: Carter Proclaims Father's Day
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI) President Carter, a father of four, today proclaimed June 17 as Father's Day. He noted that nowadays fathers were being asked to play a bigger role in bringing up children.

title: A Hardship Test That Flunks
description: The unemployment rate is a social statistic that no longer tells society what it needs to know: how many families are suffering economic hardship. Families with a single breadwinner, for example, feel the pinch of a lost job more than families with two breadwinners  and there are increasingly more of the latter. People with fulltime jobs paying $3 an hour probably have a harder time making ends meet than highly paid, if temporarily unemployed, auto workers.

title: Who Sneaked the Mohre Into 'sweeney Todd?
description: ACOUPLE of minor mysteries this morning, mysteries I am not altogether prepared to unravel but that may be worth a moment's pondering.

title: Pope Picks Vatican Diplomat as Secretary of State
description: ROME, April 30  Pope John Paul II appointed Archbishop Agostino Casaroli, an Italian who is identified with the Roman Catholic Church's search for accommodation with Communist goverments, as his Acting Secretary of State.

title: Taxes
description: ALTHOUGH taxreturn time is now a receding memory for most Americans, millions of taxpayers must begin to grapple with the problem of estimating how much tax they will owe the Government when they file their 1979 returns next April. And, to avoid paying a penalty, they must pay at least 80 percent of that amount before Jan. 15, 1980.

title: Music: Flute and Guitar
description: PARTLY because a few extraordinary players and teachers came along and extended its technical resources enormously, the flute has become one of the instrtunents most closely identified with avantgarde music in the last 25 years or so. Not so the guitar, which has retained a conservative character and certainly does not rush to mind when the words contemporary music are heard. However, the flute and guitar are famously congenial partners in traditional music, so their meeting on newer ground was sure to happen sometime.

title: Sakharov Asks Release Of Last 3 in Hijacking
description: MOSCOW, April 30 (Reuters)  Andrei D. Sakharov said today that he had appealed to Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, to free the last three men still jailed for their role in an abortive hijacking in 1970.

title: Defensive Lineman
description: The Jet goals in the pro football draft on Thursday and Friday are clear and ambitious. Walt Michaels, the coach, and Mike Hickey, the player personnel director, mean to extract from the pool of 330 athletes a defensive lineman with passrushing ability, a halfback who will contribute to a winning record and a cornerback who can start.

title: Senator Talmadge Rebuts Charges Before Ethics Panel
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  The Senate ethics committee opened public hearings today into Senator Herman E. Talmadge's tangled financial affairs and immediately ran head on into the powerful Georgia Democrat's indignation.

title: Regan Urges Albany Not to Let the M.T.A. Run Republic Airport
description: The New York State Comptroller yesterday asked the State Legislature to consider divesting the Metropolitan Transportation Authority of its role in running Republic Airport on Long Islands asserting that the field had failed to achieve any of the potential ascribed to it.

title: Egypt to Buy 7 Planes
description: CAIRO, April 30 (AP)  Egypt initialed a $400 million agreement with two aircraft companies today to buy seven passenger planes for the flag carrier Egyptair, the official Middle East News Agency reported.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, May 1 (AP)  The dollar climbed more than three yen on the Tokyo foreign exchange market today in active early trading. It opened at 222.90 yen, compared with Friday's close of 219.15 its highest finish of the year  and edged up to around 222.60 to 222.80.

title: Giants Bow to Phils, 41,
description: PHILADELPHIA. April 30 (AP) Greg Luzinski hit a tworun homer and Garry Maddox homered with the bases empty to lead the Philadelphia Phillies to a 41 victory over the San Francisco Giants tonight. It was the Giants eighth straight loss.

title: Sonny Acres Horse Farm
description: COLTS NECK, N.J., April 30 Three partners have purchased the Sonny Acres thoroughbred farm here for $700,000 from Dominick Galano of Jersey City.

title: Johns Hopkins Still No. 1
description: The difference between the Johns Hopkins and Maryland lacrosse teams is just one goal.

title: Bribery and 'soupy Sewer Pipe Charged in Suffolk
description: WESTBURY, L.I., April 30  An assistant United States attorney charged today that the main pipe leading to the treatment plant of Suffolk County's Southwest Sewer District was made with soupy concrete and inadequate steel reinforcing and that 11 pieces not built to county specifications were interspersed in it so that they could not now be located.

title: A.T.&
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  The MCI Communications Corporation, a small company that has been trying to compete with the American Telephone and Telegraph Company for a share of the longdistance market, sued the Bell System today for $3 billion and asked the Federal Court of Appeals to break UD the giant company's monopoly.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Amana Refrigeration Inc., a subsidiary of the Raytheon Company, has elected Alex A. Meyer president and chief executive officer, succeeding George C. Foerstner, who will continue as chairman.

title: Developer With Alleged Mob Ties Investing Millions in Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY  Angelo Pucci, a Toronto realestate developer who Canadian and United States officials say, is linked to organized crime, has invested $4.75 million in real estate here since June 30, according to local investigators.

title: Going to Work in 2001
description: Our Government tells us that their predictions indicate, and if they bear any fruit at all, that by the year 2050, if the current inflationary trends persist, we will be living in the situation in which a loaf of bread is going to cost $37.50, a mediumsized car, $281,000, and a modest home in an average neighborhood, nearly $3.5 million.

title: Stage: Goodbye People Revived After 10 Years
description: IT is all very well to have someone saying funny and occasionally thoughtful things to you. But not if this person is ponderous and somewhat sticky, and sits upon your chest while he is saying them.

title: Three Nominated in Connecticut To Public Utility Control Agency
description: HARTFORD, April 30  Gov. Ella T. Grasso announced today a shakeup of the State Public Utility Control Authority by nominating three new members to the fivemember board that regulates Connecticut's utilities.

title: SIGMUND SOMMER,62, REAL ESTATE DEALER
description: Sigmund Sommer, a leading real estate developer, builder and owner of thoroughbred racehorses, suffered an apparent heart attack and died yesterday at Aqueduct Race Track. He was 62 years old .

title: Yankees Beaten In 9th, 21
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., April 30  Neither Ed Figueroa's second straight lowrun game nor an altered batting order could snap the Yankees out of their doldrums tonight. They suffered their fifth straight loss, 21, to California, when Don Baylor rapped a runscoring single in the ninth inning.

title: Carey Joining Koch in Convention Site Bid
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Koch are leading a serious effort by New York City to attract the Democratic National Convention to the city next year.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The Federal Reserve, which signaled Friday that it had decided to push interest rates higher, indicated yesterday that it wanted only a modest increase, at least for now.

title: World News Briefs
description: BONN, April 30  West German authorities have arrested 10 Arabs suspected of being terrorists in the last week in West Berlin and at the West German borders with the Netherlands and Austria. The group included men described by sources in the Ministry of the Interior as members of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: EARNINGS
description: The Sperry Rand Corporation, which produces computers, flight and navigational control systems and farm equipment, reported yesterday a 16.8 percent increase in earnings in the fourth fiscal quarter ended March 31. The company said the profit and revenues were the highest for any quarter in its history.

title: LEADING MODERATES
description: SULGRAVE, England, April 30 Reginald Prentice is a bulky man with a pickwickian face who served in Prime Minister James Callaghan's Cabinet as Minister for Overseas Development. He is a member or the powerful Transport and General Workers Union. For more than 20 years, he was the Labor Member of Parliament for Newham Northeast, a downtrodden constituency in the East End of London.

title: Hospitalized Arab Says Israeli Police Beat Him in Jail
description: JERUSALEM, April 30  A Palestinian Arab journalist and publisher is in a hospital here recovering from injuries that he says resulted from beatings by Israeli policemen while he was held for 120 days without charges, and his account is being supported by a major Israeli newspaper.

title: About Education
description: DEMANDS for a return to the basics in education are viewed by budgetcutters as an excuse to strip the schools to the Three R's. One of the first victims is often art, a subject many pedagogical conservatives have considered a frill since Horace Mann, a century and a half ago, was wrapped on the knuckles for drawing a sunset.

title: Violin: Elmar Oliveira, PrizeWinner
description: ELMAR OLIVEIRA, who has played in New York many times in the past, played his first violin recital in Carnegie Hall last night. Mr. Oliveira is the young man who was cowinner of the Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow last year the first American violinist ever to win a gold medal there.

title: Evicted Colony Claims Wildlife Refuge in Georgia
description: EULONIA, Ga., April 30 (AP) group of protesters has camped on a Federal wildlife refuge that they claim rightfully belongs to them, but a Federal judge today ordered the group off the compound.

title: SEARS TRIMS PRICES IN CATALOGUE 5%
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest retailer and catalogue seller, announced yesterday that it would reduce by 5 percent all prices in its current general catalogue, effective today.

title: IN THE NATION
description: LOS ANGELES  The Rancho Seco nuclear power plant near Sacramento was one of the seven ordered closed last week by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, and lively dispute already has erupted in California as to when the plant, with its suspect Babcock & Wilcox reactor, can safely be brought back on line.

title: Deaths
description: ARONBessie Franklin. Beloved wife of Edwin Franklin and the late Samuel W. Aron. Devoted mother of Bebe Kline, Charles and Joseph George Aron. Adored grandmother of Karen and Dr. Kenneth Kline, El. Inn and Richard Aron, Dr. Stephen Aron, Or. David Aron and Wendy Aron and greatgrandmother. Servi. ces Tuesday 2:30 PM at jeffer Funeral Home. Hillside Ave at 188 St., Hollis, L.I.

title: DR. MARTIN CLYMAN, AN OBSTETRICIAN, 65
description: Dr. Martin Clyman, an obstetrician and gynecologist who was an associate professor at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine of City University of New York, died Sunday at his home in Manhattan, after a long illness. He was 65 years old.

title: Infants Delight in Their First Spring
description: It was a day for children, and for those who care for children: The April sun was brilliant. White wisps of clouds moved silently in a vast skyshow. Gentle breezes drifted in the elms and dogwoods and horse chestnuts. In Manhattan's idyllic parks, it was an afternoon of innocence and serenity.

title: Lightning Kills 2 Cowboys
description: CONROE, Tex., April 30 (UPI) Lightning struck a group of cowboys herding cattle in Montgomery County yesterday, killing two of the men and their horses. Three other riders escaped serious injury. Montgomery County sheriff's deputies identified the dead men as James Casey, 36 years old, and James Davis, 28. Deputies said the Men were struck while riding in a field near Dobbin about 9 A.M. in a thunderstorm.

title: Blue Cross Acts to Cut Cost of Tests
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP)  Blue CrossBlue Shield, the nation's largest private health insurance group, announced today that it was recommending that its member groups refuse to pay for routine hospital admission tests when patients were admitted for surgery unless their surgeons specifically certify the tests are necessary.

title: Ida Carter, 90, Teacher; Fought Ban on Marriage
description: Ida Johnson Carter, a former schoolteacher who was responsible for a ruling that made it possible for married women to teach in public schools, died Sunday at her home in Jersey City after a long illness. She was 90 years old.

title: Lung Diseases In Women Rise With Smoking
description: Emphysema and lung cancer are diagnosed more frequently in men than women, according to Dr. Harold A. Nienkes, an associate professor at the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, and most people assume that the difference results from differences in the amount of smoking or the way men and women smoke, with men being more likely to inhale or smoke more rapidly.

title: Updateon Other Strikes
description: Tugboats: Joint negotiations were held, but no breakthrough was reported in settling the 31dayold strike. The two sides are scheduled to meet separately today and tomorrow and to resume joint talks Thursday. With the city still unable to find a workable formula to allow it to hire strikers to haul city garbage, alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations continued to be suspended.

title: Jazz: Ellington in Song
description: LAST Sunday would have been Duke Ellington's 80th birthday, and to honor the occasion, the New York chapter of the Duke Ellington Society presented an afternoon concert entitled Ellington in Song. Because the late, great composer and bandleader had one foot in Tin Pan Alley, a celebration of his songs was a fitting tribute.

title: Chinese Men Beaten
description: PYONGYANG, North Korea, April 30  The powerful Hungarian men's table tennis team ended the fouryear reign of China in the world championships today with a convincing 51 rout of the players from the Peoples Republic.

title: Police Captain Facing Departmental Charges In Incident at Grocery
description: A police captain is facing departmental charges for his handling of an incident last Tuesday evening on the Lower East Side in which neighborhood youths looted and wrecked a grocery store after he ordered a police detail away from the store. A report sent to Police Commissioner Robert J. McGuire by William J. Devine, first deputy commissioner, said an investigation showed Capt. Edward Mahoney, second in command of the Ninth Precinct, exhibited poor judgment in removing the police detail.

title: AntiSemitic Dachau Vandalism
description: DACHAU, West Germany, April 30 (AP)  Vandals smeared Nazi symbols and antiJewish slogans at the site of the Dachau death camp on the 30th anniversary of its liberation by American troops.

title: Stationer's Sale of Sex Magzines Causing Bitterness
description: HILLSDALE, N.J.  A lot of people here do not want Joseph Carmel to sell sex books and magazines in his stationery store on Broadway, the main street. They say sex magazines do not belong in Hillsdale, and because of their complaints Mr. Carmel was arrested a year ago on charges of exhibiting pornographic materials and creating a public nuisance.

title: Perry Ellis: Back to College
description: Nonchalance is the word for Peery Ellis  the man and his clothes. Within the past two years, he has made a name for himself with baggy pants, mini sweaters and puffy down jackets. Nobody has been tempted to call them dropdead clothes.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: TransAtlantic

title: Mel Brooks to Film Own Version of Elephant Man
description: LOS ANGELES, April 30  A movie battle is shaping up this week over bizarre screen material  the life story of the hideously deformed Englishman known as the Elephant Man. With Bernard Pomerancets play The Elephant Man a raging success on Broadway and its producers in negotations with six major studios over a movie sale, Mel Brooks is financing his own movie on the Elephant Man, John Merrick.

title: Morocco Is Feeling Stress of War and Labor Unrest
description: RABAT, Morocco  With an economy sapped by a long war in the Western Sahara and urban centers unsettled by persistent strikes, the regime of King Hassan If and his twoyearold experiment with limited democracy are passing through a period of deep strain.

title: GasAllocation Target to Change
description: The Exxon Company U.S.A. and Texaco Inc. announced yesterday that allocations of gasoline to their service stations in May would be based on 80 percent of their May 1978 consumption. The Exxon figure for April was 95 percent.

title: The Doctor's World
description: DURING the next few weeks, in a tradition dating to ancient Greece and in a climate of renewed concern about ethics, thousands of America's newest physicians will repeat the Oath of Hippocrates at medical school graduation ceremonies.

title: Dance Machine Benefit
description: Dick Cavett will be the host of and take part in the first of eight benefit performances for the American Dance Machine tonight at 7:45 at the Harkness House. 4 East 75th Street.

title: Pope Showing Interest In Paying Visit to Israel
description: JERUSALEM, April 30 (Reuters)  Pope John Paul II has shown interest in visiting Israel, probably after he visits the death camp at Auschwitz during his trip to Poland in June.

title: The Region
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  The Environmental Protection Agency said yesterday it was granting $4 million to New York State to help clean up the Love Canal chemical dump site near Niagara Falls. The state has already budgeted more than $20 million toward the cleanup.

title: Egyptians Shrug Off the Arab Boycott
description: CAIRO, April 30  Egypt's growing isolation in the Arab world has yet to prompt real concern among Egyptians and is even being viewed as a disguised blessing by some Cairenes who are weary of competing with wealthier Arab visitors for scarce apartments, taxis and restaurant tables.

title: Bridge:
description: Wild fluctuations marked the district final of the Grand National Team Championship in Manhattan Sunday between two starstudded groups. Kathie Wei, Judi Radin, Ron Andersen, Dave Berkowitz, Peter Weichsel and Alan Sontag started strongly and led by 32 international match points after 16 deals.

title: Orioles 8. Mariners 7
description: SEATTLE, April 30 (UPI)  Eddie Murray drove in his third run of the game in the 10th inning tonight to give the Baltimore Orioles an 87 victory over the Seattle Mariners. The Orioles. who have won 11 of their last 12 games, moved to within a half game of the firstplace Boston Red Sox in the American League East.

title: New Developments Speed Detection of Lung Diseases
description: NEW developments in the early detection of emphysema and chronic bronchitis  so early, in fact, that evidence of the lifethreatening diseases can be found even before symptoms are obvious  have been reported in the second Surgeon General's Report on Smoking and Health, which was to be released for general distribution today.

title: Comex Silver Futures Climb by Daily Limit
description: All Comex silver futures prices closed up their daily permissible limit of 20 cents an ounce yesterday, and the unrestricted spot delivery soared 22.90 cents. Each cent move in silver represents $50 per contract of 5,000 ounces, which requires an initial cash margin of $2,000 to $2,500

title: U.S. Is Water Polo Victor
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, April 30 (AP)  The United States defeated Bulgaria, 63, in the second round of an international water polo tournament today. In an openinground match yesterday, Yugoslavia topped the Americans, 64.

title: CubanExile Tour Agency Chief Dies of Gun Wound in San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., April 30 (UPI) Carlos Muniz Varela, director of the Viajes Varadero Agency, which organized tours of Cuban exiles to Cuba, died today without regaining consciousness after being shot in the forehead by an unidentified assilant.

title: Doctors Say Federal Food Plans Have Slashed Gross Malnutrition
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  A team of physicians who in 1967 found widespread hunger in America's backward rural areas and in urban slums said today that Federal food programs created in the last decade had eliminated most of the gross malnutrition in those areas.

title: U.S. Aide Promises Regulatory Review
description: President Carter will soon recommend that Federal regulation of a number of industries be reexamined, Douglas M. Castle, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, said here yesterday.

title: A New Tube
description: LONDON, April 30 The London subway system, already renowned for its comfort and other amenities, became a bit more convenient today with the opening of a new line through one of the busiest parts of town.

title: Talks Continue as Strike By Gas Deliverers Looms
description: Negotiations continued early this morning in an effort to avert a strike by truck drivers who deliver gasoline to service stations in New York City, Long Island, Westchester County and northern New Jersey.

title: $35 Million Loan Is Asked for 3d Tunnel
description: Mayor Koch and state officials appeared before the House Subcommittee on Water Resources yesterday to ask for a $35 million Federal loan for the study and maintenance of New York's Third Water Tunnel. The tunnel was characterized in testimony as the answer to the city's watersupply and delivery problems.

title: 2 Sides Consider A Plan to Settle Building Dispute
description: While striking apartmenthouse employees in New York City distributed thousands of rentreduction applications to inconvenienced tenants, negotiators for the union and the building owners met separately late yesterday to consider recommendations for a settlement of the weekold strike.

title: Challenge of Kennedy: President's Annoyance Breaks Out
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Very rarely does President Carter let the public see what his most trusted aides describe as his celebrated temper, and the fact that it burst out today on national television suggests how impatient and sensitive he has become to certain criticism from Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Belridge Oil Gets Takeover Bids
description: The Belridge Oil Company, a closely held petroleum producer in Los Angeles, announced yesterday that it had received takeover bids and that it had named Morgan Stanley & Company of New York as financial adviser to help it explore possible sale or merger.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: Following is a transcript of President Carter's news conference in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of ABC News:

title: Dance: Latin Limelight
description: LATIN Limelight, presented by the Puerto Rican Dance Theater this last weekend at the Martin Luther King Jr. Auditorium, was ostensibly a celebration of Latin American choreography. On the evidence of the six choreographers premieres seen on Sunday afternoon, Hispanic choreography has variety and color. It also suffers from the same dearth of new ideas as the rest of the dance world.

title: Koch Names Nadel as New Head of City Personnel
description: S. Michael Nadel, who helped negotiate state fiscal help for New York City last year, was sworn in yesterday as the $54,000ayear director of the Department of Personnel.

title: Associated Press
description: HERO'S WELCOME FOR DISSIDENTS IN ISRAEL: Mark Dymshits, left, and Eduard S. Kuznetsov being welcomed in Tel Aviv by Prime Minister Menachem Begin. They were among Soviet dissidents released and flown to New York on Friday in exchange for two Soviet spies. Thanks to your efforts, we have arrived to be with you, Mr. Dymshits said. I'm happy that after nine years I can Join my family and my country in my homeland.

title: President and Falk:yin: One Serve, One Return
description: WASHINGTON, April 313  The great tennis court debate goes on. President Carter steadfastly maintained at his news conference today that he did not personally rule on requests to use the White House tennis court, as was charged most recently by James Fallows, formerly the President's chief speech writer.

title: Around the Nation
description: PITTSBURGH, April 30 (AP)  A monthiong strike by teamster steel haulers faltered today as many dissident drivers returned to work, but the steel industry still had many workers idled.

title: Brewers 8, Indians 0
description: CLEVELAND, April 30 (AP)  Jim Slaton fired a twohitter, Ben Oglivie cracked two home runs and Gorman Thomas slammed a threerun shot to pace the Milwaukee Brewers to an 80 victory over the Cleveland Indians tonight.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The Trans World Corporation, the holding company for Trans World Airlines Inc., announced yesterday with Spartan Food Systems Inc. that their boards of directors had approved an agreement in principle whereby Spartan would be acquired by a wholly owned subsidiary of Trans World.

title: Topics
description: The great spring floods in the South and Midwest give rise to a question: Why do we submit so stoically to the calamities of inanimate nature but not to those of human nature?

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 354390,0 UNTIL 530 PM FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS UNTIL 2 30 PM ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9 00 A M TO 4 30 PM MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY,NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 3.3900. WESTCHESTI R CO. AND...NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE LAINS 9.5300, NASSAU CO (516) 7470500, SUFFOLK CO (16) 6691800. CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767

title: Price Violations Denied
description: Two wellknown paper product concerns, the Crown Zellerbach Corporation and the Hammermill Paper Company, denied yesterday that they were in violation of President Carter's voluntary price guidelines.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Clines and Gross Share The Mike Berger Award
description: Francis X. Clines of The New York Times and Kenneth Gross of Newsday have won Columbia University's 1979 Mike Berger Award, it was announced yesterday by Osborn Elliott, the dean of the university's journalism school.

title: Morgan Guaranty Raises Broker Rate
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company raised the rate it charges brokers for financing their invent. ,ries to 10 percent from 10 percent, effective today, the bank announced yesterday.

title: Books: US. Musicals From 1767 Till Now
description: APATTERN for the American musical theater that has persisted right through the, present season was established as long ago as 1767, when what seemingly was the first native American musical, aptly named The DisapAMERICAN MUSICAL THEATER, A CHRONICLE. by Gerald Bordman.749 pages. Oxford University. $35. pointment, closed in Philadelphii. The reason given at the time was that as it contains personal reflections, it is unfit for the stage. Since then, it has not required the presence of personal reflections to lead to the same conclusion about innumerable other musicals that got as far as Philadelphia.

title: Child Custody: A Conference Evaluates the Options
description: NEW HAVEN  I call the court of domestic relations the court of the insoluble, said Judge John F. Shea. Every morning I pray that I do as little harm as possible.

title: Notes on People
description: Medical Graduates Choose Hawkeve as Speaker

title: Dividends
description: xcorroany adlusts previously annotmad declaration of 3.06.

title: Reporter's Notebook: The Visiting Bosses
description: They may be first with the news, molders of opinion and the lenses through which Americans view the world, but when they get together, as a couple of thousand of them have for the past 10 days here, the publishers and editors of America seem pretty much like everyone else.

title: Q&A
description: Assoclated Press

title: ABC Raises Pierce to No. 3 Post
description: Frederick S. Pierce, the executive who engineered ABCTV's climb from third place to first among the networks, yesterday was promoted to executive vice president of the American Broadcasting Companies Inc., a corporate post that has been added to his present position as president of ABC Television.

title: Science Watch
description: The Government of Finland is planning to make that farnorthern nation 40 percent selfsufficient in energy within the next 10 years, using peat and wood for a substantial portion of its needs.

title: Ginzburg Depressed
description: Aleksandr Ginzburg was wearing blue jeans yesterday, jeans faded to a light blue softness, and a shirt broadly striped in shades of gray. The Polish suit I was given by the K.G.B. still smelled too much of the K.G.B. , he explained with a shrug of distaste. I just wanted to get out of that suit of clothes.

title: A Return to Sail Proposed for Cargo Vessels
description: SEVERAL prominent naval architects and engineers have begun to envision New York Harbor teeming with cargo vessels bearing the vans now carried on container ships but propelled by large triangular sails.

title: EDUCATION
description: BALTIMORE

title: Norton Simon, Avis Accord
description: David .J. Mahoney, chairman and chief executive of Norton Simon Inc. and Warren E. Avis, founder of the rentacar company that bears his name, announced jointly yesterday the satisfactory settlement of litigation pending in New York and California over the use by Mr. Avis of his name in a new business he established.

title: State and Jail Guards At MakeBreak Point In Contract Dickering
description: ALBANY, April 30  Negotiators for New York State and its 7,000 striking prison guards said today that their talks had reached a critical stage, and one state official said that a settlement to the 12dayold strike would come now or not for another 30 days.

title: PRESIDENT DECLARES HE EXPECTS RUSSIANS TO ADHERE TO PACT
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  President Carter said today that the Soviet Union would not violate a new strategic arms treaty because to do so could lead to an American rejection of the entire treaty, would threaten Soviet relations with Washington and could possibly result in a nuclear confrontation.

title: Fred Coe, Producer and Director In Golden Age of TV, Dies at 65
description: Fred Coe, the producer and director who was a catalyst for putting much of the best drama on live television a score of years ago and who helped start many leading writers, directors and actors on their careers, died of a heart attack late Sunday night in Los Angeles. He was 64 years old.

title: Fans Are Avid for IslanderRanger Renewal Tonight
description: The biggest hockey show in years the surprising RangersIslanders semifinal Stanley Cup series  will move to Madison Square Garden tonight. But even the world's most famous arena isn't large enough for the interest the battle has generated.

title: Film: Gouveia, Brazil Folklore
description: PERHAPS because most of Geraldo Sarno's previous directorial experience has been with documentary film making, the narrative of his Colonel Delmiro Gouveia is sometimes obscure. The story, of a turnofthecentury industrialist, has apparently become part of Brazilian folklore. And so Mr. Sarno has divided his film's point of view among several characters, as if a group of different ballads about the man had merged into one.

title: I.B.M. Chief Attacks U.S. on Suit
description: SAN DIEGO, April 30  Speaking at a shareholders meeting that approved a 4for1 stock split, the chairman of the International Business Machines Corporation said here today that unparalleled customer demand foretold a bright future for the company

title: Strike Deadline of Friday Set by Union at Uniroyal
description: AKRON, Ohio, April 30  The United Rubber Workers said today that it would strike Uniroyal Inc., a major American tiremaker, at 12:01 A.M. Saturday if the two have not agreed on a contract by then.

title: Coleman Expects Heat Pump to Shine
description: WICHITA, Kan.  Coleman, the company that brought light to rural America with its gasoline lamps, is now out to heat and cool customers everywhere.

title: New Zealand Students Attacked
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, May 1 (AP)  Maoris and Pacific islanders used clubs, chains and an iron bar to attack students at Auckland University today because they objected to the students parody of the haka, a Polynesian dance, in a university program. One student required 16 stitches after being clubbed with an iron bar. Others suffered cuts, bruises and bloody noses.

title: Around the Nation
description: WARRENSVILLE HEIGHTS, Ohio, May I (AP)  Two men dressed as policemen abducted the board chairman of a supermarket chain and his wife today, then shot and wounded the couple after demanding $1 million ransom, the police said.

title: TV: OldFashioned Romance on CBS
description: TORN Between Two Lovers, the movie on CBSTV tonight at 9 o'clock, is a woman's picture in the oldfashioned sense that it is carefully designed to allow wives romantic fantasies while husbands probably take to biting their nails nervously.

title: Events
description: PEOPLE IN SHOW BUSINESS MAKE LONG GOODBYES, by H. Jean Schaetter,the Orpheum Theater, 126 Second Avenue, 6:45.

title: Indian Point Nuclear Crisis Plans Stir Confusion and Disagreement
description: BUCHANAN, N.Y.  The plans prepared by the Consolidated Edison Company and the state for dealing with the possibility of a major accident at theIndian Point nuclear power complex here have created confusion and much dis agreement among company, state and local officials about their areas of responsibility.

title: Stocks Off Sharply On London Board
description: LONDON, May 1 (AP)  Shari prices closed sharply lower on the London Stock Exchange today a: traders reacted to reports that indi, cated Prime Minister James Callaghan's Labor Party was gaining support and that Thursday's general election would be a close race. The Financial Times index fell 9.4 points to 541.9.

title: Trade a Key Topic
description: TOKYO, May 1  Recent signs that Japan's giant trade surplus with the United States is shrinking sharply are expected to be pressed by Prime Minister Ohira in order to take some of the starch out of stiffening criticism over Tokyo's overwhelming trade advantage. But private trade analysts here doubt that the narrower trade gap is here to stay.

title: Garbage Still a Problem As Buildings Strike Ends
description: New York City was still struggling to get out from under piles of garbage when the strike by buildingmaintenance workers in Manhattan ended yesterday.

title: House Defeats Attempt to Revive Urban Aid Program
description: WASHINGTON, May I The House today effectively killed an attempt to revive special Federal aid to cities with high unemployment, a program that could have meant $42 million for New York City this year.

title: The Flip
description: WHAT is really surprising about inflation is that anybody is surprised about it at all. Yet, here we are in 1979, with our skeletal dollars buying less than half of what they bought in 1967. and everyone is crying, Oh me, oh my, or other phrases suitable for literature in which astonished chickens speak in jeremiads.

title: Best Buys
description: Computers and supermarkets.

title: A Pitch for Good Music
description: GAMBIER, OhioOn a recent television show, four actors appeared on stage garbed as performers in a musical ensemble. A preposterous scene ensued. One actor pummeled the piano, another puffed mightily into a sour recorder, the third stroked bizarre arpeggios from a harp, and the fourth stood erect and emitted a series of random screeches. The aural effect was ludicrous.

title: Yale Provost Resigns After Dispute Over Cost of Renovating Home
description: NEW HAVEN, May 1,  Abraham Goldstein, the provost of Yale University, has resigned as, Yale's chief budgetary and academic officer following a conflict with A. Bartlett Giamatti; president of Yale, over money the provost spent on renovating and redecorating his universityowned house.

title: Postal Service Is Cleared For SameDay Delivery
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (UPI)  A Federal judge today dissolved a temporary restraining order that blocked the Postal Service from beginning an experiment in guaranteed sameday, intracity mail delivery. The Government agency said it hoped to begin the service in three cities this week.

title: Padres Surge in 7th;Topples Mets by 105
description: The lack of depth on the Met pitching staff came sharply into focus at Shea Stadium last night. Manager Joe Torre used five pitchers in a futile effort as the San Diego Padres scored a 105 victory.

title: Currency Shifts Cut Nestle Net
description: VEVEY, Switzerland, May 1 (UPI)The Nestle group reported today consolidated net profits for 1978 of $434.7 million, a 10.9 percent drop from the 1977 figure of $488 million.

title: SAUDIS LEADERSHIP ATTACKED BY SADAT
description: CAIRO, May 1 President Anwar elSadat attacked Saudi Arabia's leadership today, accusing it of using pressure and Payoffs to persuade other Arab states to break relations with Egypt.

title: Wrightsmans Give Met 2 Old Master Paintings
description: Two European old master paintings of exceptional importance have been given by Mr. and Mrs. Charles Wrightsman to the Metropolitan Museum. They are The Miracle of Christ Healing the Blind by El Greco (15411614) and The Penitent Magdalen by Georges de La Tour (15931652). Both paintings are on view in the European painting rooms at the Met, and it is clear that quite apart from their outstanding quality they fill major gaps in the collections.

title: Florida Gas Now Trenex
description: The Florida Gas Company announced yesterday that its shareholdera had approved changing its name to the Trenex Corporation. Selby Sullivan, chairman and president, said Trenex was an acronym for transportation, energy and exploration and was intended to present the company in its broader scope as a diversified energy company.

title: Private Lives
description: IHAVE been following her career for years, and I suspect that I am not alone. These years of following have made me feel rather like dirty 5Ild man, or a Charles Dodgson. We sit, after all, on folding chairs in a darkened auditorium, a motley of strangers in her thrall. In the light, on the stage, sue grows up trom 14 to 15 to 15 to 17. On the advice of my doctors, I am only permitted to see her one night each spring, when she is singing and dancing. What she does with the rest of her life, I have no way of knowing and would prefer not to think about, thank you.

title: About New York
description: Even as America grew yesterday, it was reproducing: Flinching with early labor pains, Margo Dayan, a radiantly pregnant immigrant from Mexico, had to be rushed out of turn from the 329 petitioners for citizenship gathered in Brooklyn, so she could pledge allegiance and renounce all foreign princes and potentates with more than the usual sense of emotion.

title: Foods That Invite a Bit of Sinful Excess
description: I CAN live without the necessities but not without the luxuries, the late Frank Lioyd Wright is reported to have said, and apparently there are a good many middleclass Americans who agree with him. For while most shoppers are searching out inexpensive cuts of meat and lowprice fish to pinch pennies, sales in luxuryfood stores and restaurants indicate that there is still good deal of splurging.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, May 1,1979

title: Corporations Report Their Sales and Earnings Results for the Quarter
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on Me New York Stoic Exchange. (A) the American Exchangeand (0) overtheCounter.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Bags, Belts and Colors

title: Three Different American Fashion Looks
description: New York's fashion designers are no homogenous group. They're as diversified as the women they clothe throughout the country, with roots in the past and tendrils extending into the future. Three who presented their fall and winter collections this week indicate the range that encompasses the American look.

title: Cancer Is Reported in Lab Animals Exposed to Drugs Used by Millions
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  Scientists at the National Cancer Institute reported today that laboratory animals had developed cancer after exposure to drugs and cosmetics used by millions of Americans to calm high blood pressure, fight dandruff and induce drowsiness.

title: Americans Appeal to Argentina To Let Detained Editor Visit U.S.
description: A group of Americans asked Argentina yesterday to let Jacobo Timerman. a former newspaper editor now under house arrest, to visit New York as a guest of the Columbia School of Journalism.

title: Television Gets First Look at a Jersey Trial
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 1  For the first time since the days of the Lindbergh kidnapping, cameras and broadcast microphones returned to the courtroom in New Jersey today.

title: Money
description: TUESDAY. MAY 1, 1979

title: Quebec Liberal Chief Wins a Vote
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, May 1 Claude Ryan, the Montreal newspaper editor who assumed the leadership of the Quebec Liberal Party last year in an effort to bead off a threat by Quebec to secede from Canada, won a decisive victory in a byelection yesterday for the provincial Assembly.

title: The WellSpent Dollar: Good Food For Less
description: ONE of the nicest and bestintentioned tributes to French chefdom appeared some years ago in a publication that stated that a fine toqueblanche can make even a thistle taste good. This was all well and good until it was pointed out that the elevated artichoke is a member of the thistle family.

title: Chief of Army Reported Selected By Carter Over 18 High Generals
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  President Carter, in a surprise move, has reached down into the Army hierarchy to select a threestar general, Edward C. Meyer, to serve as Army chief of staff, Administration sources said today.

title: Ballet: The Seldom Seen Enliven FundRaiser
description: AMERICAN Ballet Theater held a Million Dollar Celebration Monday night at the Metropolitan Opera House as a reminder of the $1 million from the National Endowment for the Arts that it must match with $3 million. And as pas de deux succeeded pas de deux and pas de trois, one was also reminded that this gala was what galas are about, but certainly not what ballet is about.

title: Bruins Win, 21
description: BOSTON, May 1  Brad Park, who has been one of the Boston Bruins mainstays ever since he was traded from the New York Rangers in 1975; scored the winning goal tonight with 3 minutes 12 seconds to play and gave Boston a 21 victory over Montreal. He also trimmed Montreal's lead to 21 in the fourofsevengame Stanley Cup semifinal series that resumes here Thursday night.

title: TV RATINGS
description: Following are the top 15 national television shows Me past week (Monday, April 23, to Sunday. April 29), listed according to their rank in the ratings compiled by the A.C. Nielsen Company. A rating is a percentage of the total number of United States households with felevision'sets.

title: Kennedy Meets Carter, Then Repeats Critique
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (UPI) President Carter and Senator Edward M. Kennedy shook hands in a receiving line at the White House today, and the Massachusetts DemOcrat then stepped outside and repeated his criticism of the President's oil conservation Man.

title: Japanese Devouring Novels About Invasion by Russians
description: TOKYO, April 30  Kanji Suga leafed through the books at Asahiya, a busy bookstore in the Ginza. He wore a smart brown lightweight suit, was about 30 and seemed intent but easygoing, a not untypical customer at one of Tokyo's largest bookshops, where younger executives are the backbone of the trade in hardcover books.

title: A Spring Shower for Rockefeller Center
Inexpensive Recipes: They Call for Prudent Shopping
description: PRICES in the following recipes reflect the lowest average expenditure based on two weeks of shopping special sales at supermarkets and comparisonshopping at fruit and vegetable stands and specialty shops.

title: Military Draft: An Issue That Doesn't, Fade
description: The draft, buried with no mourners when the last draftee entered the Army in 1972, once more is the focus of controversy with college students petitioning against its,revival and the Army's Chief of Staff, supported by an array of senior officers and members of Congress, arguing for its resumption or, at a minimum, the national registration of 18yearolds.

title: U. S. Aides Say Coast Company Sold Pakistan Atom Plant Units
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  Administration officials said today that a California company last year sold Pakistan components that could be used in a plant to produce weaponsgrade uranium.

title: Soviet Military Units Reappear in May Day Parade
description: LONDON, May 1 (AP)  Soviet military marching units made their first appearance.in a May Day parade in Moscow in 11 years today, and tens of thousands of Iranians marched through Teheran in a kind of labor celebration that the Shah had banned during his rule.

title: Bus Strike Begun in Gary, Ind.
description: Gary, Ind., May I (UPI)  Bus drivers went on strike today, forcing thousands of Gary commuters to find other means of transportation,

title: 2 Dissidents Lunch With Koch And See a Union Demonstration
description: Two exiled Soviet dissidents watched from the steps of City Hall yesterday while thousands of chanting, shouting New York City union members marched in opposition to the dissidents luncheon host, Mayor Koch.

title: Three in Family Die in Fire
description: PERKASIE, Pa., May I (UPI) A fire that ripped through a house here today killed three members of a family  each from a different generation. The victims were identified as Marian Albrecht, 71 years old; her daughterinlaw. Carolyn, 35, and granddaugter, Anita, 9.

title: NBC, CBS Release Schedules for Fall
description: NBCTV and CBSTV yesterday announced their fall program schedules.

title: Edper Buys More Stock In Brascan
description: TORONTO, May 1  Edper Equities Ltd., a Canadian investment company, made substantial new purchases of shares in Brascan Ltd. today in a move that may scuttle Brascan's attempted takeover of the F.W. Woolworth Company.

title: One Flight Above, Congeniality Rules
description: The ice was in tall glasses in Room 200 last night at Madison Square Garden, while one floor below, on a 200foot long ice surface, two teams clawed and snarled at each other.

title: Wisconsin Backs Amendment
description: MADISON, Wis., May 1. (AP)  A constitutional amendment to give Washington, D.C., residents representation in the United States Senate and House cleared the Wisconsin Senate today. A 19to13 vote sent the proposal, drafted last year by Congress, to the Assembly.

title: Silurian Award to Blum And Buder of The Times
description: Howard Blum and Leonard Buder of The New York Times have received an award for investigative reporting from the Society of the Silurians for their sixpart series: TwoYear War for a South Bronx Heroin Empire.

title: Music: Watts's Emperor
description: IT is just 22 years since Andr Watts first appeared with the Philadelphia Orchestra, as the winner of a children's audition. It is almost twice that long ago that Eugene Ormandy, who will step out next year as music director, began his association with the orchestra. Last night at Carnegie Hall, the two musicians  once again teamed up, this time for Beethoven's Emperor Concerto.

title: 3 RIGHTS GROUPS AID A COLONY OF BLACKS
description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People and at least two other civil rights organizations sent lawyers and organizers yesterday to a swampy coastal region of Georgia in support of black families unlawfully camped at the Harris Neck National Wildlife Refuge about 30 miles south of Savannah.

title: COMMODES
description: Copper futures prices broke sharply yesterday afternoon and provoked a wave of selling in the nearby Comex silver ring, where traders had been waiting for a signal to convert some of their large recent paper profits into cash.

title: Resurgent Fiedler Opens 50th Season
description: BOSTON, May 1  Arthur Fiedler, the conductor who mixes the incongruous with the incompatible to produce an irreverant musical blend beloved all over the world, returned triumphantly to the stage of the Boston Pops Orchestra tonight to begin his 50th season.

title: The City
description: Justice Milton Mollen, the presiding justice of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, has stepped in to guide negotiations between the Board of Education and the school bus drivers who have been engaged in a wildcat walkout for 11 weeks. Justice Mollen held his first meeting with top school officials and leaders of the Amalgamated Transit Union locals 11811061 yesterday, and some progress was reported.

title: Merrill Lynch Sees
description: CHICAGO, May 1 (AP)  Merrill Lynch & Company, owner of the nation's largest stock brokerage firm, expects a recession and a subsequent bullish stock market within the next year, its chairman, Donald T. Regan. said today.

title: Mitsubishi Plastics Fined In Celanese Secrets Case
description: GREENVILLE, S.C., May 1 (AP) Mitsubishi Plastics Industries was fined $50,000 and ordered to forfeit an additional $250,000 after pleading no contest today to Federal racketeering charges.

title: N.Y. Horse Aiming for Derby First
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 1  On the day Sir Ivor Again won the Cousin Handicap at Aqueduct last month, his owner got up at 6 o'clock in the morning to make a roundtrip plane flight from Miami to New York and back.

title: Inadequate Welfare's Wider Costs
description: New York State's relief allowance is inadequate and, as inflation exacts its toll each day, the grant is increasingly unable to provide a floor to protect the health and welfare of poor families.

title: Dining Out, Far From Mott St.
description: If I were packing to travel to China today (and would that I were), there would be two articles in that suitcase as imperative as toothbrush and comb. Precisely, they would be two new travel guides. One is Fodor's People's Republic of China (David McKay Company, $10.95), now in bookstores, and the other is The China Guidebook, by Arne J. de Keijzer and Fredric M,. Kaplan (Lippincott, Eurasia Press, $8.95), which will be available around midMay.

title: Talmadge Aides Concede Questionable Accounting
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  Aides to Senator Herman E. Talmadge conceded today to the Senate ethics committee that they had submitted questionable office expense vouchers, but they contended that they were only routinely following office procedures established by Daniel Minchew, the former aide who has become the Georgia Democrat's main accuser.

title: Three Counties to Sell Home Mortgage Bonds
description: Three Kentucky counties plan to proceed with competitive sales of taxexempt singlefamily home mortgage revenue bonds this week in the belief that they would not be affected by a ban on such financing under a bill introduced in Congress last Wednesday.

title: Muskie in Brussels for Talks
description: BRUSSELS. May 1 (Reuters)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, arrived in Brussels today for discussions at the headquarters of the European Common Market and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: U.S. Steel Building Plan Backed
description: PITTSBURGH, May 1  David M. Roderick, who took over as chairman of the United States Steel Corporation last week, conceded in his first news conference in that post yesterday that the nation's largest steel company was going through a few hard spots in the road partly because of its decision to keep modernizing and building new facilities during the recent severe downturn in steel.

title: WASHINGTON George Bush for President?
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  By age (55), appearance (handsome), location (Texas) and reputation (exemplary), George Herbert Walker Bush is clearly justified by experience and character to challenge the older leaders of the Republican Party for its Presidential nomination. This he has now done. He has the blessing, among others, of former President Gerald Ford, who thinks it's time for a new generation of Republican leaders to take over, but who stands to gain if George Bush falters and the Republicans are forced to fall back on the oldtimers  ronald reagan of California, John Connally of Texas, and maybe even Mr. Ford himself.

title: EARNINGS
description: The LTV Corporation reported yesterday a firstquarter net income of $40.5 million, or $1.41 a share, in contrast to an $8.8 million loss incurred in the 1978 quarter. Consolidated sales for the quarter rose to $1.98 billion from $1.24 billion.

title: Wine Talk
description: THERE is a new wine scandal in France, and it could easily have a more serious impact on the imported wine trade in this country than the famous fraud case in Bordeaux six years ago. In the current case, Bernard Grivelet, a controversial Burgundy wine maker has been accused by a French Government agency of mislabeling wine later sold in the United States. In a telephone interview from France, Mr. Grivelet did not deny the charge. But, he said, it is a problem of how the wines are registered; a problem of paper, not of wine.

title: Stage: World of the Blind
description: HE is blind and she is going blind. They meet in a home where books are read to those who cannot see. Sightlines, a new play by Mark Eisman at the Joseph Jefferson Theater Company. is a twoDart invention about an incapacitated middleaged couple. It is a kind of Gin Game about blind people, elevated in performance by Douglass Watson and Marge Redmond, who are the play's entire cast

title: Charities Plan an Organized Challenge to Monopoly of United Way
description: DALLAS, May 1 United Way, the nation's biggest and bestknown charity fundraiser, is under increasingly bitter assault by a host of small charities that charge that it is systematically cutting them off from the best, surest and cheapest source of donations payroll deductions in offices. factoriesand storer.

title: Sears Case Sharpens Price Guide
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 In negotiating a rollback of prices with Sears, Roebuck & Company, the Government's chief pricewage monitor, Barry P. Bosworth, has made explicit an element of the Administration's voluntary price restraint guidelines that was not previously discussed.

title: World News Briefs
description: NAIROBI. Kenya, May 1 (UPI) Uganda today announced plans for a new army to replace its Tanzanian allies, who are marching north to rescue hundreds of foreign missionaries from roving bands of Idi Amin's troops.

title: Market Place
description: Hedge on Rise In Oil Prices

title: RCA Expects Sharp Dip In NBC's 1979 Earnings
description: The National Broadcasting Company will have sharply lower earnings this year, according to Edgar H. Gnffiths, president and chief executive officer of the parent RCA Corporation.

title: State Emergency Plan Study Urged
description: The plans developed by New York State for dealing with a major accident at Indian Point are intended to pick up where Con Edison's procedures leave off  handling all the contingencies that may arise. outside the 239acre nuclear power plant complex.

title: Ayatollah on Khomeini's Council Is Slain by Islamic Guerrilla Band
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Wednesday, May 2 An important member of Iran's revolutionary leadership was shot and killed last night by an underground Islamic guerrilla group.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: About Real Estate
description: While he was in the Army in the 1950's, Charles Daun came to love trucks. He believes that true appreciation of the truck depends upon a knowledge of its technology. I look at a truck and I see differences in engines, in transmissions. he said.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: IT ALMOST goes without saying that the ultimate hastilymade main course is a plain omelet. I have never understood the awe and fear that most home cooks seem to face when it comes to omeletmaking. You simply beat eggs in a small bowl with salt and pepper, add them to a smoothbottom omelet pan in which butter is heated, and a second later, you turn it out onto a dinner plate.

title: Work Break, Play Break
description: It was a good day for sitting yesterday, the second straight week day of temperatures in the low 70's. Restaurant workers at the Metropolitan Museum took their break on a sunny park bench, while skaters in Central Park adjusted their wheels on a warm curbside. Forecast for today promises much the same weather in the metropolitan area.

title: Books of The Times
description: OPTIMISM: THE BIOLOGY OF HOPE. By Lionel Tiger. 318 pages. Simon & Schuster.$10.95.

title: Reorganization Plan For U.S. Foreign Aid Is Criticized as Weak
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  Specialists from inside and outside Congress criticized President Carter's plan to establish a new agency to coordinate American foreign assistance. programs today on the ground that it lodged too little authority in the agency's director and did little to reorganize aid programs.

title: Lift the Cap on Hunger Spending
