description: The Charter Oil Company said that it had completed acquisition of the Carey Energy Corporation with a $4 million cash payment to Edward M. Carey, brother of Governor Carey of New York.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: SHORTLY before noon last Monday, writes Amy Vossen, I stood in the rain across from City Hall Park with three or four other wouldbe passengers, waiting for Third AVenue bus. When one pulled up, we all got in: I sat in the front. near the driver.

title: Vanished In Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES  As he left his apartment on a recent morning, the young man told his wife that he was going down the street on a brief errand and would soon return. When he failed to reappear after several hours, his wife went to the local police station to see if there had been an accident. Neither she nor her husband has been seen or heard from since. This is life in Argentina today.

title: Carter Criticized in London Study
description: LONDON. May 15 The International Institute for Strategic Studies said today that President Carter had failed to assert a proper leadership role in the western world.

title: In Soviet Bloc, Economics Is Key to Unity
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  The six countries of Eastern Europe that were once regarded as political satellites of the Soviet Union have now become its economic dependents.sphere, as in no other aspect of relations, the Soviet Union and its allies are natural partners. The Russians have vast deposits of raw materials that the East Europeans could not afford to buy on the world market, and the East Europeans have farm products and manufactured goods to meet a rising Soviet demand.

title: Neighbors Making The Bronx Healthier
description: One looks down Rochambeau Avenue to where it abuts Gun Hill Road in the north Bronx, and there is Montefiore Hospital and Medical Center. The hospital seems geographically central to the community it serves. And in fact some new things that are happening in those classic, gray, sixstory preWorld War II tenements derive from the hospital's presence.

title: CARTER SAYS PUBLIC REFUSES TO FACE UP TO CRISIS IN ENERGY
description: WASHINGTON, May 15  President Carter scolded the American people today for what he said was their refusal to recognize that the nation was confronted with an energy crisis.

title: Regan Orders a Scrutiny Of New York Realty Tax
description: Edward V. Regan, the state's Comptroller, directed his audit staff yesterday to evaluate New York City's, entire realestate tax structure. He expressed concern that the city might be losing revenue unnecessarily because of exemptions and abatements of property taxes that have reached a level of more than $1.5 billion a year.

title: About Real Estate
description: The decision has been made, and Howard Pomerantz personally confirmed it last week: Glendale, Queens, will not lose its powderpuff factory.

title: The Saudis and the Camp David Three
description: That master showman, Anwar elSadat, is talking about a fundraising drive of a magnitude normally attempted in the United States only for Israel by the United Jewish Appeal. He could. he says. ask Congress for a further loan of $525 million for the 50 American F5 fighters that Saudi Arabia promised to buy for Egypt but now won't. He prefers instead to go on American television to solicit contributions from the public.

title: Canada AT A GLANCE
description: The roots of the FrenchEnglish conflict were laid by explorers of the two nations searching for the northwest passage to Asia at the end of the 15th century and the beginning of the 16th. The conflict was intensified by competition for North America's fur trade and by the European wars between France and England, which were paralleled in North America. With the Treaty of Paris in 1763, France ceded to England all its North American possessions except Louisiana. In colonial times, the conflict centered on the CanadianAmerican border that now, at 3,987 miles, is the world's longest undefended boundary. Canada, a country of 3,851,809 square miles, covers most of the northern part of North America. Its northeastern and central regions, which encompass Quebec, Ontario, the Maritime Provinces and part of the Northwest Territories, are important sources of minerals, wood pulp and hydroelectric Canada has many lakes, including 9 that are over 100 miles long and 35 that are over 50 miles long, besides the Great takes.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS Gold Continues to Gain; Dollar Mostly Stronger
description: Gold prices reached new highs yesterday while the American dollar improved against most currencies in New York and European foreignexchange markets but slipped against the yen in Tokyo and the pound in London.

title: House Panel Denied Data On Water Contamination
description: The Hooker Chemical and Plastics Corporation, in defiance of a Congressional subcommittee's request, has refused to supply the subCommittee with records from a 1968 study it made of the contamination of ground water, drinking wells and a lake in Montague, Mich., from one of its chemical dumps there.

description: Spokesmen of Brascan Ltd., seeking to take over the the F. W. Woolworth Company, said yesterday that South Carolina's deputy Securities Commissioner, Stanley V. Lewis, had found Brascan's offer of $35 a share for Woolworth stock fair to the retail chain's stockholders.

description: THE advertising business,changes every 10 years, or at least so thinks Marvin Honig, executive vice president and creative director of Doyle Dane Bernbach, New York.

Some of the writers are throwing surprise luncheon for him in New York. What the hell, one of the others said. let's eo.

title: Economic Scene
description: HONG KONG; May 15  Secretary of Commerce Juanita M. Kreps and her team of advisers and negotiators came out of China today in a Slate of quiet elation over what they had accomplished. Specifically, they had reached seven agreements between the United States and China on a broad range of matters  financial and economic, scientific and technological. This was more than twice all the agreements previously reached between the two countries.

description: Raymond Hays, president of the LTV Corporation  confirming published reports of substantial savings from its acquisition of the Lykes Corporation said in Dallas that savings this year might reach about $49 million. ine savings will result mainly from combining operations of LTV's Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation and Lykes's Youngstown Sheet and Tube Company, he said.

title: WASHINGTON A Spasm Of Pessimism
description: WASHINGTON, May 15  Nothing fundamental has changed in this country in the last few weeks, but suddenly the mood seems different: more confused, quarrelsome and pessimistic.

title: Best Buys
description: WHAT is the supermarket's biggest energy consumer? In many stores it's the frozenfood case; according to a recent nationwide survey, frozen foods account for 24 to 49 percent of a grocery store's electrical bill. The average is about onethird of a supermarket's total energy cost, and that figure is likely to rise as the price of each kilowatthour climbs..

description: GOLDEN NUGGET INC., an operator of a Funbling casino and, hotel in downtown Las Vegas, hopes to construct a 560room hotelcasino on the Boardwalk in Atlantic City and has already raised money for the purpose.

description: WASHINGTON, May 15  A staff report to the House Foreign Affairs Committee sharply criticized the United States Embassy in Guyana today for failing to act on warning signals of the trouble at the People's Temple in Jonestown.

description: TORONTO, May 15  Question. What famous British city was the focus of a vast sea evacuation in the face of advancing guerrilla troops?

description: It takes time and patience to enter the China market successfully, whether exports or imports are involved and whether a large or small firm is participating.

description: When he was a young lion at Brooklyn College, Irwin Shaw played football, not terribly well, perhaps, but often. I believe, the writer once recalled, that we were the only team in the history of American football which before its opening game had never scrimmaged, lined up for a kickoff or thrown a pass. We lost, 38 to 0, to Trenton State Teachers.

description: Carl Bradley never thought his life would be affected by the laws of Illinois. After all, he didn't live there.

description: NEWARK, May 15 (UPI)  A shareholder filed a classaction suit today against the General Public Utilities Corporation and 10 of its directors, charging that they bad withheld information about the Three Mile Island nuclear plant in Pennsylvania.

title: Stage: Awake and Sing!
description: N seeing the revival by the Roundabout Theater of Awake and Sing! the Clifford Octets drama about Jewish life in the workingclass Bronx of the early 1930's, one is seized by melancholy ruminations on the sad futility of seeking to rekindle passions out of one's past, of anticipating warm glows from sparks that have long since faded.

title: Symphony: Schweizer's Historical
description: THE scenario for Monday night's concert at Avery Fisher Hall was like something out of the glory days of the 19th century. An obscure young Swiss composer, Heinrich Schweizer, had sequestered himself in a Swiss village for more than a year to write his 50minute Historical Symphony. Then he took it with him to the big city and began trying to hunt up enough money to get the music heard. Some four years later, he was able to book Fisher Hall and engage the American Symphony to play it, David Gilbert to conduct it and the Boys Chorus of St. Thomas Church to sing in it.

title: Canadiens Even Series, 11, With a 62 Rout of Rangers
description: MONTREAL, May 15  It was more than hockey.. IV was what hockey becomes in Stanley Cup play  an improbable drama that, tonight, ended as playoff dramas have so often for the Canadiens.

description: HIS is gutsier than anything I've ever done, Phyllis Newman announced with her highpitched, nervous giggle. I'm just sorry that I waited so long.

title: Auto Sales Off 11.5% for Early May
description: DETROIT, May 15 (UPI)  The nation's auto makers reported a sales decline of 11.5 percent for early May today, despite a continued surge in smallcar purchases suggesting that gasoline shortages were beginning to have an impact on the automobile market.

description: The Penn Central Corporation said it had formally completed the sale of about 93 percent of the common stock of the Pittsburgh and Lake Erie Railroad Company to the Pittsburgh and Lake Erie Company, a newly formed corporation. The sale totaled $59.6 million.

description: BRUSSELS. May 15  The defense ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization agreed today to continue pressing for an annual increase of 3 percent in defense spending through 1985 and to spend $4.5 billion to improve facilities to be used for rapid reinforcement of the allies in Europe in the event of war.

title: Stocks Up Slightly in Heavier Trading
description: Stock prices registered a slight advance yesterday in accelerated trading, with some of the specialsituation and gambling issues making the best gains.

description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)Senator Herman E. Talmadge's accountant said today that the small gifts of cash the Senator contended he had received from supporters over the years may have gone for official expenses rather than personal expenses, as the Georgia Democrat has said.

description: A broken band of cloudiness stretches from New England through the Middle Atlantic States to Florida. A second band of clouds stretches from the Ohio Valley to the Southern Plains States with thunderstorms and showers occurring in the northern Appalachians and the Plains States. Clear skies are apparent elsewhere.

description: TEHERAN, Iran (AP)  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini met yesterday with delegation of Iranian Jews and assured them of fair treatment, the Government radio said. According to the broadcast, the delegation told the Ayatollah that recretted olots of Zionism.

description: Lucky Kibitzer Is Helpful To Rosenberg in Club Final.

title: House Panel Spurns Bid To Spare Cuts in Amtrak
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP)  President Carter's plan for deep cuts in Amtrak passenger service survived what will probablly be its last Congressional test today when a House panel rejected a move designed to kill the proposal.

title: Nesib S. Trabulsi, 96, Textile Manufacturer
description: Nesib S. Trabulsi, long a leader in the textile field, died Sunday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 96 years old.

title: Netting Bargains: A Fish Story
description: ALTHOUGH there is not much to be,said in favor of inflation, it, has brought about at least one positive result: In an effort to stretch shrinking food budgets, Americans are adding variety to their diets by eating many things they formerly ignored. Nowhere is this increased variety more apparent than in local fish markets, now almost as interesting as aquariums, what with the strange and exotic species currently on display. Having discovered the hard way that salmon, striped bass, trout, sole, halibut, shrimp and scallops are not exactly inexpensive alternatives to meat, shoppers are becoming more adventurous and are trying many fish whose names were unknown to them even six months ago. In some cases, these unfamiliar species are bona fide delicacies elsewhere. The huge, wobbly and amorphous monkfish just now being introduced here is the treasured lotte of the French, and the long, pewter gray dogfish or sand shark, with its compact, snowy white meat, is known as palombo to Italians, who serve it crisply fried or simmered in a garlic and basilscented tomato sauce. In many instances, socalled bottom and trash fish gain popularity and their prices rise all too rapidly. Whitings sold for 49 cents a pound four or five years ago ID but now range from $1.10 to $1.35 a pound, and blowfish, discarded by both and ea mercial fishermen 15 years ago, were renamed sea squabs and, when available, bring $3.75 a pound on the wholesale market, according to Mike De Martino of De Martino's Fish Market, 132 Eighth Avenue near 17th Street (2436639). In the view of Professor John Isaacs, a marine scientist with the Scripps Institution of Oceanography in San Diego, the growing popularity of these heretofore uneaten fish varieties has two important advantages. Not only can people buy them less expensively than other fish, but by doing so, the environmental balance of the oceans will be much improved.

title: ROBERT W. PECKHAM
description: Robert W. Peckham, director of corporate communications for the St. Joe Minerals Corporation of New York, died Saturday at Dobbs Ferry (N.Y.) Hospital. He was 43 years old and lived in ArdsleyonHudson. Mr. Peckham is survived by his wife, Sandra; a daughter, Linda; two sons, Robert and Thomas; a brother, James, and his parents, James and Constance Peckham.

title: Israel Reports Inflation Grew by 8.7% in April
description: TEL AVIV, May 15 Israel's spiraling price index surged .8.7 percent last month, the Central Bureau of Statistics announced in Jerusalem today.

title: I Remember Mama Delayed
description: The opening of the Broadway musical I Remember Mama, starring Liv Ullmann, has been postponed to Thursday, May 31. The show had originally been scheduled to open May 3. It played 51 performances in Philadelphia before going on previews in New York last month.

title: Joseph Lyman, 72, Dies in Maine; Helped Develop Direction Finder
description: KENNEBUNK, Me., May 15  Joseph Lyman, an engineer, inventor and pilot who contributed to the development and flight testing of the first aircraft automatic direction finder, died Sunday at the Maine Medical Center in Portland. He was 72 years old.

title: Decision Hailed in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 15  Chile's major newspapers carried editorials today supporting the decision by Chile's Chief Justice to deny a United. States request for the extradition of three military officers allegedly involved in the assassination of Orlando Letelier.

title: F.C.C. Approves Comsat Rate Cut
description: WASHINGTON, May 15  The Federal Communications Commission today approved a 15 percent rate reduction by the Communications Satellite Corporation.vit will no into effect tomorrow.

title: New Conflict Charge Is Raised at BusShelter Hearing
description: A survey of New York's 500 bus shelters, used by the city to show that Bustop Shelters Inc. was not maintaining their properly, was conducted by a subcontractor of Bustop's chief rival for the shelter franchise, according to evidence submitted at a hearing in State Supreme Court in Manhattan yesterday.

title: American Movies Play. Starring Role at Cannes
description: CANNES, France, May 15  In a frenzy of moviegoing, wheeling and dealing and roundtheclods parties, the 32d Cannes Film Festival has exploded in an unabashed lovein with America. From the opening film, Hair, to Woody AllenallManhattan, both ecstatically received, to the eagerly awaited premiere Saturday of Francis Coppola's Apocalypse Now, it is, above all, the American films that are creating the excitement as the 14day festival moves into high gear.

title: 4fting Age to 19 In Buying Liquor Gets Grasso Veto
description: HARTFORD, May 15  In her first veto of the year, Gov. Ella T. Grasso today killed a bill that would have raised to 19 years the minimum age for making Phases from liquor stores.

title: Lakers Set to Make Johnson No. 1 Choice
description: The Los Angeles Lakers, who have the first pick in the National Basketball Association college draft June 25, are expected to announce today that Earvin (Magic) Johnson will be their choice.

title: A Look at the Brown Case 25 Years Later
description: TOPEKA, KAN. THE Buchanan Elementary School, empty for 20 years, sits ignobly neglected. The fence has been torn down. The Dlavground where I played baseball is overgrown with weeds, and the windows of the sturdy, twostory brick structure are boarded up. Many neighboring houses suffer the same fate. And where rambling shingled houses once stood, there are empty lots, like gaps between decaying teeth. Tennessee Town, named by the blacks who migrated to this section of Topeka at the turn of the century, isas forlorn as a poor crone's smile.

title: Parking Meters Foiling Vandals
description: The New York City Bureau of Traffic. Operations said yesterday it expected to collect $2 million more this year from its parking meters than in 1978 because of the use of vandalresistant coinholding devices. This would bring the projected total to about $14 million, according to the bureau. The meters, which were first installed 18 months ago, now make up 25,000 of the 60,000 in use throughout the five boroughs. Another 15,000 such meters are being installed and an additional 20,000 are expected to be ordered.

title: Black Aides Discuss ConcernsOver Carter Record
description: WASHINGTON, May 15  A group of middlelevel black officials in the Administration, all political appointees from Georgia who campaigned for Jimmy Carter for President in 1976, have held a series of private meetings here in recent months to discuss their concerns over the Administration's record on minority issues.

title: Envoy of Central Africa Disputes Charge 100 Students Were Killed
description: RABAT, Morocco, May 15 (AP)  An official of the Central African Empire said today that Amnesty International's charge that his Government had killed about 100 students was utterly unbelievable.

title: Vietnamese Aide Says HalfMillion Want to Leave
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 16  A ranking Vietnamese diplomat said today that 400,000 to 600,000 people wanted to leave southern Vietnam and that Hanoi was ready to let them join the several hundreds of thousands who had fled since 1975.

title: Arctic has Find Reported
description: CALGARY, Alberta, May 16  Panarctic Oils Ltd. has announced a major natural gas discovery in Canada's far north, which it said could lift Arctic reserves to the level needed for commercial exploitation of the area.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: AT one time, residential dimmers were a luxurious type of wail switch used only to create a certain lighting mood in a room. But today, because of solidstate circuitry, almost all dimmers :or the home are also energyefficient, car lower electric bills and greatly extend the life of a light bulb. Fullrange dimmers will save more energy than the simpler highlow dimmers because the lower range is greater. but even wher you dim to onehalf, you save half the power. while your light output is onethird the normal brightness and your bulb life is extended by 10 times.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: Music: The Chicagoans
description: SIR GEORG SOLTI and his Chicago Symphony Orchestra remain one of thggreat perplexities of presentday concertgoing, at least as far as this puzzler is concerned. It's gushy and false simply to burble on about how wonderful they are, because they just aren't always so wonderful; interpretively. Yet it's equally sillyto berate them as secondraters, because they quite clearly aren't that, either.

title: Dow Up Despite Bearish News
description: The stock market posted a small advance yesterday despite some bearish economic developments. Several specialsituation issues ranked among the best gainers.

description: The elusive phone call, every race driver's fantasy, that Howdy Holmes will always remember came Tuesday, April 17.

description: Banco de Santander of Bogota, Colombia, which has been operating in New York through a representative office, now has opened a fullservice branch here. The bank, which has assets of more than $12 billion and:deposits of more than $5 billion, joins a grow, ing number of foreign banks increasing their operations here.

description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)  president Carter sent to Congress today a proposal to require states to put up 5 to 10 percent of the costs of socalled pork barrel water projects that have customarily been entirely financed by the Federal Government.

description: A. Philip Randolph, the black labor leader who helped found the modern civil rights movement, died yesterday at his home in Manhattan.

description: WASHINGTON, May. 16 - President Carters political aides stepped up their efforts this_week to work with Gcwernor Carey and Senator Daniel Patrick Moyni, han on4joint effort to win Mr. Carter's renomination and reelection.

title: North Carolina School Said To Use Ineligible Players

Dryden, the brother of Ken Dryden, the goaltender for the Montreal Canadiens, was also named to the league's first team allstars. He joins Rick Ley of New England and Rob Ramage of Birmingham.

McGill, the president of Columbia University, speaking yesterday at the school's 225th commencement exercises, praised the university for having survived a decade that began with Volatile and seemingly insoluble problems and for having emerged stronger for the experience.

description: Morning

title: Market Place

Actually, according to one practitioner of what is commonly but inaccurately called arbitrage, it could be done by clerk with two modest qualifications  first, he must have aboveaverage intelligence; second, he must be able td read.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES

title: ABROAD AT HOME The System Worked
description: WASHINGTON  One of the transforming events in American history occurred 25 years ago today. The decision of the Supreme Court in Brown v. Board of Education has changed the American landscape to an extent unanticipated even in the drama of that time.

title: Ecuador: Oil Is Key
description: LAGO AGRIO, Ecuador  The Pacific port city of Guayaquil now has more than a million residents, and the booming mountain capital of Quito soon will. But the economic future of Ecuador lies here in the midst of the muddy rivers and tropical growth of the Amazon.

title: Johnson, Lakers Agree on Pact
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (AP)  The Los Angeles Lakers announced today that they had reached agreement with Michigan State's Earvin (Magic) Johnson, the player they will take as the first pick in the National Basketball Association draft.

title: ESSAY The Sinking Ship
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  When the water reaches the upper lever, F.D.R.'s Navy Secretary, Claude Swanson, used to say, follow the rats.

title: New Workspaces: It's a Lot Like Home
description: THE sunlight floods through the huge twostoryhigh leaded windows. bringing the outdoors inside. In the vast spaces, the occupants share a feeling of camaraderie and privacy.

title: West Germany Postpones Building a Key Atom Plant
description: BONN, May 16  West Germany, reacting to the recent nuclear accident near Harrisburg, Pa., postponed indefinitely today construction of a nuclear reprocessing plant considered central to the nation's energy program for the next two decades.

title: U.S. ROLE IS LOWKEY AT U.N. TRADE TALKS
description: MANILA, May 14  Car for Chad to the main entrance.

title: Round Top Festival To Open June 8 in Texas
description: ROUND TOP, Tex., May 15 - The 1979 Round Top Festival, the only major music festival in Texas, will open June 8 and continue for five weeks, offering a chamber orchestra, chamber music, solo recitals and musical seminars by professional critics and nationally known music administrators.

title: Ballet: Harlequinade
description: THE New York City Ballet's dancers turned themselves into animated toys Tuesday night at the New York State Theater.

title: Books of The Times
description: BROCA'S Brain: Reflections on the Romance of Science is a collection of Carl Sagan's essays, and there should be no objection to that. After all, BROCA'S BRAIN. Reflections on the Romance of Science. By Carl Sagan. 347 pages. Random House. S12.95. writers have been collecting their occasional pieces ever since the alphabet was invented. And Carl Sagan - not only one of our leading astronomers, but also one of our better science writers (as his prizewinning The Dragons of Eden has attested) - is an able enough essayist.

title: Chrysler Cleared for G.M. Data
description: WASHINGTON. May 16 (AP)  Federal antitrust officials gave the Chrysler Corporation clearance today to purchase technical information from the General Motors Corporation on the development of emission controls and socalled passive seat belts.

title: Pirate Homer Tops. Mets in 13th
description: PITTSBURGH, May 16  Mike Easier, whose nickname is Easy, made winning tonight's game for the Pirates look just that way when he belted Skip Lockwood's first pitch of the 13th inning for a pinch homer to give Pittsburgh a 43 triumnh over the Mets The payoff shot by Easier, who spent last season at Columbus leading the International League in hitting (330), was made off a high fastball and cleared the rightfield fence by a few feet.

title: Small Replicas Of Great Houses
description: IN an effort to preserve the old, the elegant and the noble in architecture, a young Frenchman named Daniel (Daj) Martin has created an unconventional art form. Over the last few years, Mr. Martin has built 40 clay models of historic and stately homes, ranging from the Chateau de Bonneval in France and York Castle in Tangier, to the ruins of Carclew in Cornwall and Assington Hall in Suffolk. And that's not tai mention spectacular Stowe Castle,,Mr. Martin's own residence in Buckingham.

title: A House Slipcovered in Metal
description: LAST year it was the vast Sunset Boulevard mansion with vulgarly painted statues on the front lawn; this year it seems to be the architect Frank Gehry's house that is the Los Angeles area's chief attentiongetting residence. Cars drive by, slow down and even stop as their occupants peer out at the building, which seems to offend some, amuse others and intrigue virtually all.

title: TOP POP RECORDS
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide. compiled by Record World. a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets, singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: Fervent Iranians Flock to See the Ayatollah in His Capital
description: QUM, Iran  The Lurs were getting restless.

title: About Dobbs Ferry
description: DOBBS FERRY, N.Y., May 19 The drizzle i$ soothing on Main Street and Bill KalVs small apartment blends with the midday calm of America as he turns on his tape recorder to hear the monthly word about what's been going on.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: A few broken clouds are visible over New England while clear skies are apparent in the rest of the East. Scattered showers and thunderstorms are seen over the Plains States and into the Southwest Broken patches of clouds associated with a cold front cover the northern Rockies.

title: News Summary
description: Rhodesia and South Africa hailed the Senate request to President Carter to lift economic sanctions against Rhodesia as a key victory for the incoming black majority Government and a major setback to guerrillas fighting the administration. Britain's new Conservative Government sent an emissary to Salisbury, marking the first time that an American negotiator has been excluded from highlevel talks there since the BritishAmerican peace effort was begun. [Page Al, Columns 12.]

title: Film Took a Gamble That May Pay Off
description: LOS ANGELES WHEN the heads of 12 Hollywood unions stormed onto the set of Winter Kills in March 1977 to close the movie down the actor Anthony Perkins told the movie's writerdirector, Bill Richert. to keep smiling. In a similar situatication Mr. Perkins said helpfully, Orson Welles had lifted the camera to his shoulder, tied it to his Volkswagen and continued shooting without a crew.

title: Oil and Gas Holdings Disclosed by House Members
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) - More than two dozen members of the House of Representatives today disclosed that they had fmancial interests in oil and natural gas in 1978, according to newly released documents.

title: ExLufthansa Agent Guilty In $6 Million Airport Theft
description: A 46yearold former Lufthansa Cargo agent was found guilty yesterday of helping to plan and carry out the $6 million armed robbery last December at the airline's Kennedy International Airport cargo terminal.

title: Rock: The Three Roches
description: EVERY once in awhile the Bottom Line comes up with one of its highexcitement, tension. packed showcase engagements. Tuesday night the Roches save their first performance in New York City since the release of their debut album as a trio on Warner Bros. That record has been greeted with more extravagant critical praise, at least from New Yorkbased newspapers and magazines, than any record since Bruce Springsteen's Born to Run. The club was full, not only with the sisters cult, but with all sorts of musicbusiness types and just plain fans who wanted to see and hear what the hype was about.

title: Advertising
description: Special to The New York Times WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W.Va., May 16  Leonard S. Matthews, the new president of the American Association of Advertising Agencies, disclosed at the opening session of the 61st annual meeting at the Greenbrier Hotel here this afternoon that the average memberagency profit last year was the highest since 1966. The return in 1978, he reported, was 4.65 percent, compared with the 4.98 percent recorded 12 years earlier.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Spurred by signs of a downturn in the economy, traders bid prices sharply higher in the credit markets yesterday.

title: Screen: 'Christa Klages':Profoundly Political
description: "THE Second Awakening of Christa Klages," which opens today at the Film Forum, is a very earnest movie about a young woman who, to finance her day-care center, robs a bank (with two male accomplices) and then finds that her associates at the center will not accept the stolen money.It's one of the curious things about this 1977 West German movie, the first to be directed by Margarethe von Trotta, that what happens to the money and, indeed, to the day-care center and the children, never seems very important. The bank robbery turns out to be less a means to an end than a theoretical gesture that, having been made, becomes its own reason for being.Yet "The Second Awakening of Christa Klages" is a surprisingly involving sort of movie. Though it wanders, it wanders with a certain purpose, the way some intelligent people talk when they are trying to get a fix on complicated subjects. Miss von Trotta, who has collaborated on the screenplays for "A Free Woman" (in which she also acted), "Coup de Grace" and "The Lost Honor of Katharina Blum," all directed by Volker Schlondorff, her husband, is a feminist of striking movie-making talent."Christa Klages" looks and sounds very sober, but it is full of odd associations and images that distinguish the work of a true film maker from that of a well-studied hack. It is never predictable. And while the plot is rather absurd, the film is emotionally and stylistically consistent.Miss von Trotta has also cast her film nicely with Tina Engel, who suggests a young Hildegard Knef, as Christa, and Silvia Reize as Christa's longtime friend, Ingrid. In secondary but no less effective roles are Marius Muller-Westernhagen, as an ex-seaman who accompanies Christa on her life of minicrime, and Peter Schneider as a young clergyman, a fellow who preaches the need for action but is unable to act in any unconventional way himself."The Second Awakening of Christa Klages" is a didactic film, but it is never smug in the manner of a film that knows all the answers. It's mostly about uncertainty, and about the need to take risks and to make choices. In this sense, it's more profoundly political than even the outraged "Katharina Blum," which was based on the novel by Heinrich Bll and which never allowed the audience to think for itself."The Second Awakening of Christa Klages" can be seen at the Film Forum tonight through Sunday at 7:45, and next week, Thursday through Sunday, at the same time.

title: A Winning Playground
description: LANDSCAPE architecture got a running start in New York City in the 1850's when Frederick Law Olmsted designed Central Park. But until 1970 there was no teaching facility here to guide students in urban landscape architecture. Then the landscape architect M. Paul Friedberg, whose firm recently designed the new fountain in City Hall Park, proposed such a course to City College. The City College's School of Architecture now offers  with Mr. Friedberg at the helm the first fully accredited undergraduate urban landscape architecture program in a major city.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: DETROIT, May 16 (AP)  The American Motors Corporation will expand car production by 25 percent later this month to meet swelling demand for small cars, its top executive said today.

title: Seven on Brzezinski's Staff Resign; An Aide Talks of Midterm Blues
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  Seven of the 40 foreignpolicy specialists on Zbigniew Brzezinski's staff have left the National Security Cotincil in recent.weeks, and a few more are expected to depart shortly. white House officials announced the resignation today of William B. Quandt, a Middle East. expert, and also said that Samuel Hoskinson, an intelligence aide, would soon bk leaving to work for John B. Connally in his bid for the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: World News Briefs
description: TOICYO, May 16 (AP)  Vietnam will withdraw its troops from Cambodia if China cuts off its aid to the guerrilli forces of the ousted Cambodian Prime Minister; Pol Pot, a highranking Vietnamese official said here yesterday.

title: A College Graduate's Next Step: Getting a High School Diploma
description: KATONAH, N.Y., May 16  Emil Berendt got his Bachelor of Science degree in March from the University of the State of New York and next month he will pass yet another milestone in his educational career  a high school diploma.

title: Weicker Pulls Out of C.O.P. Race; Won't Back Any Other Candidate
description: HARTFORD, May 16  Senator Lowell P. Welcher Jr., citing his poor showing in the polls, withdrew today from the race for the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THERE AND NOW The vintage paintings of Morocco by Louis Comfort Tiffany included in New York University's recent retrospective of the artist were an exotic, reminder of that country's land and peoples in years past. A new photography exhibition by Geno Rodriguez, Maghreb, Where the Sun Never Sets, surveys the contemporary scene. The display is on view today through May 30 at the PhelpsStokes Fund at 10 East 87th Street.

title: CARTER RETHINKING Ills RHODESIA POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Carter Administration was seeking a new approach today to southern African problems after its unexpectedly lopsided defeat yesterday, when threefourths of the Senate voted in favor of lifting sanctions against Rhodesia.

title: Getty Talks Fail Again
description: Negotiators for the Petroleum Trades Employees Union and Getty Oil failed yesterday to resolve their contract ditpute and scheduled further talks for next Monday, a union spokesman reported. He said that Getty was persisting in its previously announced plan to lay off 55 gasoline truck drivers in New York and contract the delivery work to the Island Transportation Company.

title: Trade Deficit for April Is Reported by Japan
description: TOKYO, May 16  Japan reported today that it had a trade deficit of $361 million last month its first April deficit on a customs clearance basis in five years In the first four months of 1979, the Finance Ministry reported, Japan's deficit on a customs clearance basis amounted to $469 million, a rapid dive into the red after last year's surplus of $18.2 billion.

title: Now for a Cup of Boiling Noise
description: If the Forum is the cathedral of hockey, Madison Square Garden is the caldron. And for tonight's third game of the Stanley Cup final, the caldron will be boiling with more noise than ever before. Noise when the New York Rangers skate on to the ice. Noise as they whirl around during the warmup to the thumping music of the Superman theme. Noise when they go back to their dressing room. Noise when they return to the ice to the accompaniment of the Star Wars theme. Noise almost as soon as the national anthem beeins.

title: Ohrenstein Heatedly Warns Carey Democrats Must Hcrve Role on Bills
description: ALBANY, May 16 - Unhappy at being taken for granted, the leader of the Senate's Democratic minority, Manfred Obrenstein of Manhattan, today made public a letter to Governor. Carey stating that the Senate Democrats would not support any controversial administration bills that had not been negotiated with them.

title: Protection for Witness In Talmadge Case Set After Report of Threat
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) - The Senate Select Committee on Ethics said today that it had ordered roundtheclock protection for its chief witness against Senator Herman E. Talmadge because of a threat against the witness's 2yearold daughter.

title: Hers
description: I WAS married, had three children, and was the copossessor of an apartment high above Park Avenue, before I paid any attention to the trains at night. Trains that rush as dirty water does under that broad avenue. hidden water and inelegant. I knew there were railroad tunnels under Park Avenue. For years I took trains that passed through them, on my way home from college. I rather liked the notion of such grime and hollowness beneath the solid, respectable feet of the sentinels that march up the avenue and down it again. beamish buildings that signify arrival, somewhere.

title: Bridge:
description: Whether a club event can be a world championship, even an unofficial one, is highly debatable. The World Bridge Federation says no, but the Cavendish Club in Manhattan, which organized a world individual championship earlier this week, is of the contrary opinion.

title: For George Delacorte, Adorning The City Is a Dream Come True
description: In this age of angst, George Delacorte is an outrageous anomaly. He is rich and not ashamed of it; he likes giving lavish presents and getting credit for it, and he is probably, even, a happy man.

title: Nilsson Out of Playoff Game
description: The Rangers and Canadiens will produce the greatest gate in National Hockey League history, $330,000, for Game 3 of the Stanley Cup final playoffs tonight, but Ulf Nilsson, who commands a salary almost double that, will not skate in the Madison Square Garden contest.

title: Israeli President Visits Settlers on. West. Bank and Offers Assurances
description: JERUSALEM, May 16  President Yitzhak Navon, visited Jewish settlements in the West Bank territory today, for the first time since he became head of state last year. Thd visit was seen as an assertion of Israeli rights to establish new communities in the land conquered during the 1967 war.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Twentyeight years ago, Kemmons Wilson, a Memphis. builder, onetime popcorn vendor and World War II pilot. was in Washington, D.C., with his family and came to the conclusion that hotels were too crowded and expensive for ordinary tourists. So. in 1952, he built the first Holiday Inn in his hometown and developed the idea of the national motel chain.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Pirates, at Pittsburgh. (Television Cablevision, radio WMCA, 7:30 P.M.)

title: Theater: Dixie Girl Cafe, Talk in Rural. Georgia
description: IN Last Days of the Dixie Girl Cafe, Robin Swicord demonstrates a certain facility for evoking local color - and an extremely limited comprehension of character development and dramatic structure.

title: United Press International
description: TANZANIAN TROOPS CAPTURE AMIN STRONGHOLD OF LIRA: Troops boarding ferry to cross Lake Kyoga in northern Uganda, yesterday, to launch surprise attack on the key stronghold of Lira. However, after wiping out a convoy of troops loyal to Idi Amin, the attacking forces found Lira to deserted. The town's capture leaves only two northern cities, Gulu and Arua, former President Amin's hometown, in control of the deposed leader's forces.

title: 85 Gas and RollsRoyce, In Demand in Westport
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 16- Usually I'd get out five, six times a week, said Dolores Pocograno, Now I go out once a week, unless it's a dire emergency.

title: GasSaver Car Set for Production
description: Will the Moodymobile, a muchmodified Mercury Capri using diesel power, produce the 57 to almost 80 miles a gallon that its designers claim when subiected to davindavout use?

title: Radio
description: Music

title: New Senate Hearings Promised on Nuclear Secrets
description: Senator John H. Glenn said yesterday that he would reopen his investigation of the Department of Energy's practices for guarding nuclear weapons secrets as a result of the department's disclosure that a classified document on nuclear weapons had erroneously been placed on the public shelves at the Los Alamos (N.M.) Scientific Laboratory and marked declassified.

title: Along Canada's Border, Almost a Third Country
description: EDMUNDSTON, New Brunswick Cecille Bechard is a Canadian who visits the United States several dozen times a day  when she goes to the refrigerator or the back door or to make tea, for instance. To read and sleep she stays in Canada, and she eats here too if she sits at the north end of the kitchen table.

title: Electronic Mail and Post Office
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The United States Postal Service said today that it must open an electronic mail service to keep up with changing communication demands and assure stable employment for its work force of 650,000.

title: McMullen New Owner Of Astros
description: John J. McMullen, who is a limited partner in the Yankee ownership and owns more stock in the American Shipbuilding Company than George Steinbrenner, became the new owner of the Houston Astros yesterday.

title: N.Y. Telephone Net Climbs 11%
description: The New York Telephone Company and its wholly owned subsidiary, the Empire City Subway Company, reported net income yesterday of $132 million an increase of 11 percent for the first quarter against $118.9 million cleared in the initial three months last year. Operating revenues were up 6.5 percent to $1.19 billion, while operating expenses and taxes advanced 6.1 percent to $1 billion. The company said its rate of return on capital investment for the quarter rose to 9.08 percent from 8.58 percent a year ago.

title: Gulton Gets Flxible Contract
description: Gulton Industries has won a $3.2 million contract from the Grumman Flxible Corporation to provide luminator information display systems for 837 advanced design buses purchased by the New York City Transit Authority and the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority.

title: Jazz: Joya Sherrill Sings
description: JOYA SHERRILL, who sang with Duke Ellington's band for four years in the 40's, who has toured the Soviet Union with Benny Goodman and had her own television show in Teheran, Iran, for the last two years, is a commanding presence when she steps on the stand at Michael's Pub, where she will be signing the songs of Harold Arlen for the next three and a half weeks.

title: Libya Lifts Oil Price; Venezuela Sets Rise
description: Libya notified oil companies yesterday that, effective immediately, all grades of its crude oil would go up 70 cents a barrel. The move raises the price of Libya's best grade to $19 a barrel. or more than 45 cents a eallon. This upsets the equilibrium that had prevailed among the three big African oilproducing countries  Libya, Algeria and Nigeria.

title: Gasoline Stocks Down in Week
description: Despite a slight increase in output at the nation's oil refineries, gasoline inventories fell sharply last week, the American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday. Stocks of heating oil and crude oil also declined, the institute said.

title: U.S. Oil Demand in April Called Lowest in 2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The American Petroleum Institute reported today that the nation's total demand for gasoline and other refined oil products in April was the lowest for any month in nearly two years.

title: Hartford House Passes School Arbitration Bill
description: HARTFORD, May 16 (AP) - The Connecticut State House of Representatives today approved by a vote of 7069 a bill providing for binding arbitration in labor disputes between teacher unions and school boards.

title: ALASKAN LANDS BILL SAVING VAST AREAS APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The House today approved a con rvationistbacked bill that would protect more than 125 million acres of Federal lands in Alaska, including the calving ground of the nation's largest caribou herd.

title: Carter's Stake in Philadelphia
description: Not having to fight City Hall can be help in Presidential politics, so one of the first congratulatory telephone calls to William J. Green, after he won Tuesday's Democratic mayoral primary in Philadelphia, came from the man whose, via tory in the 1976 Pennsylvania primary all but won him the Presidential nomination, Jimmy Carter. Mr. Green, a former

title: The Region
description: LOWER ALLOWAYS CREEK, N.J. (AP) - Six more damaged fuelrod grids were discovered yesterday in the Salem I nuclear reactor here as inspectors checked the possibility that inner supports cracked as fuel rods were replaced, according to a spokesman for the Public Service Electric and Gas Company. Fortythree of the 193 assemblies remain to be checked, he said.

title: Stage: Three 'soundramas Open at Public Theater
description: THE Marx Brothers (including cousin. Karl) meet the new music in Carson Kievman's madcap program of three samdramas, collectively entitled Wake Up, It's Time to Go to Bed!, that opened last night in the Public Theater's Luesther Hall. A pianist suspended in midair on a rickety scaffolding plays sweeping arpeggios while prim butler solicitously turns the score's pages.

title: Still No Mother Bomb
description: For several years now, demographers have been holding their breath. Because of the 15year baby boom that followed World War II, there is now a record number of potential young mothers in the population. they were having children at anything like the rates their mothers did, the nation would be experiencing genuine population explosion. But now it begins to look as though a sigh of relief may be in order.

title: Bonn Announces Steps To Cut Oil Consumption
description: BONN, May 16  The West German Government today announced the first concrete steps aimed at cutting the country's oil consumption in the face of sharply rising oil prices, but it continued to assert that there was no danger of an oil shortage here.

title: Ford and Cummins In Accord on Diesel
description: The Ford Motor Company has made an agreement with the Cummins Engine Company for development of a lightweight, turbocharged diesel engine for use in passenger cars and light trucks.

title: Helen Gahagan Douglas Gets Ovation and Medal as Barnard Hails
description: Helen Gahagan Douglas, the stage, screen and concert star who was a success in politics, too, until Richard M. Nixon thwarted her attempt to move from the House of Representatives to the Senate in a bitterly fought race in 1950, starred on Broadway aeain yesterday.

title: Sound
description: PUT a new count on the old adage: Three heads are better than two. At any rate, the present proliferation of threeheaded cassette decks is a welcome trend. A few years back, tripleheaders could be found only among such ultraprestigious brands as Nakamichi and Tandberg. Lately, such designs have also been appearing in the midprice range.

title: Associated Press
description: TWO DEAD IN MIAMI SHOOTOUT: A man who shot two women in a car, one of whom was alleged to be his wife, later killed in an exchange of gunfire with police. One police officer was killed, two others were wounded in incident.

title: Music: A 180Foot Tape
description: HOW, asked the program notes for H. Lugus's concert Tuesday evening at the Kitchen, does the average consumer experience his or her hifi set? Our experience is usually restricted to exasperation when an unexpected hiss or buzz intrudes on the music; the perfect stereo system, like the drop of vermouth in a dry martini, never draws attention to itself. But for Mr. Lague curator of music at the Forum Stadtpark in Graz, Austria, the medium is the message and the music, too.

title: 2 Black Leaders Differ Over Split Between Poor and Middle Class
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 - Two prominent black officials differed today on the existence and importance of a schism between poor blacks and middleclass blacks.

title: 2 on Council Say Developer Cheated City and Tenants
description: A developer who received a $2.3 million tax abatement, for converting a rundown hotel on Manhattan's Upper West Side into socalled luxury apartments committed fraud by misleading tenants and by clainiing abatements for work that was not done properly or not dofie at all, two members of the City Council charged yesterday.

title: Dollar Closes Mixed
description: The dollar continued to show strength on world currency markets yesterday, finishing mixed despite gold's sharp recent gains.

title: Arguments summarized In Trial of Queens Juddge
description: The credibility of the prosecution's key witness was the focus yesterday as both sides summarized their cases ft the grand larceny trial of Judge Robert T. Groh Of Queens Civil Court. The jury in State Supreme Court in Queens was expected to get the case today.

title: Owners Vote Today On Umpire Contract
description: Major league dub owners, meeting yesterday in Chicago, heard the terms of an agreement with striking baseball umpires that they will be asked to vote on today at the American League headquarters in New York.

title: Companies List Their Sales and Earnings Reports for Quarter
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) over-the-counter.

title: Seaboard to Buy 6,300 Freight Cars
description: Seaboard Coast Line Industries announced that it planned to buy 6,300 new freight cars for the Seaboard, the Louisville & Nashville and other railroads it operates. The cost of the purchase was put at about $275 million.

title: Industrial Output Off 1% in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)  The nation's industrial output dropped in April by 1 percent, the largest amount since 1975, while housing starts fell 2.1 percent, the Government reported today, supporting forecasts that a recession may be coming.

title: Chicago Exchange Hours
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (UPI)  The Chicago Board of Trade announced today that trading hours for the exchange's Government National Mortgage Association (Ginnie Mae) and longterm United States Treasury bond futures contracts would be extended a halfhour. The exchange voted to change the hours to 9 A.M. to 3:45 P.M. Eastern daylight time. from the current 9:30 to 3:45.

title: Promising Leads Being Checked In the Murder of 4 in Bedford Hills
description: BEDFORD HILLS. May 16 - The Westchester County District Attorney said today that investigators were still working on many promising leads in the investigation of the murders of four persons here last week.

title: 25 Jersey Gas Stations Cited on Overcharging
description: TRENTON, May 16Twentyfive of 1,500 service stations in two counties that were checked by the State Division of Weights and Measures for price gouging were found to be overcharging, the State Energy Commissioner, Joel Jacobson, said today.

title: Bullets Beat Spurs, Tie Series, 33; WASHINGTON (108)
description: SAN ANTONIO, May 16 (AP) Elvin Hayes hit for 25 points and Bobby Dandridge had 10 of his 20 in the fourth quarter tonight as Washington defeated San Antonio 108100. to send the National Basketball Association Eastern Conference final back to the Bullets home court for the decisive seventh game Friday night.

title: Khomeini Hails Workers Who Barred 20 Journalists
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 16  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini declared today that newspapers must write only what the people want.

title: MICHIGAN TO SUE U.S. ON CHEMICAL WASTES
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Attorney General of Michigan,testifying before a House subcommittee today, announced that he would file suit against the Environmental Protection Agency for doing virtually nothing to prevent poisonous chemical dumped at an Air Force base from contaminating ground water across four miles of lower Michigan.

title: Jean Rhys, 84, Novelist Known for 'sargasso Sea
description: Jean Rhys, the British novelist who was widely admired by writers and critics. but whose body of work was not widely read by the general public, died Monday in an Exeter hospital near her Devonshire cottage in the English west country. She was 84 years old.

title: Air Traffic Up 15.7% in April
description: Airline traffic is sharply on the rise, the Air Transport Association indicated yesterday. In April, domestic and international scheduled traffic increased by 15.7 percent over the same month in 1978. the association said. For the first four months of this year the increase ran 17.8 percent ahead of the similar yearago period.

title: Carey Seeks U.S. Consumer Unit
description: The Federal Government must take tougher stand on the side of the consumer by establishing a national office of consumer affairs, Governor Carey said yesterday at a luncheon of the National Association of Consumer Agency Administrators in the Statler Hilton Hotel.

title: Air Florida Adding Five Boeing Jets
description: Air Florida said it planned to buy five Boeing 737 jet airliners from Singapore Airlines because of a rapid expansion of business in Florida and addition of new routes.

title: Entertainment Events
description: MURDER AT THE HOWARD JOHNSON'S, a comedy by Sam Bobrick and Ron Clark. Directed by Marshall W. Mason; starring Tony Roberts, Bob Dlshy and Joyce Van Patten. At the Golden Theater, 252 West 45th Street, at 6:45.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, it was incorrectly stated in Business Day yesterday that the Westinghouse Electric Corporation had agreed to pay $2.5 billion to settle lawsuits involving uraniumsupply contracts. The company has settled 9 of 17 suits, for $400 million.

title: Jets Set Back Oilers, 32, For 31 Lead in Playoffs
description: WINNIPEG. Manitoba. May 16 (AP)  Morris Lukowich and Lyle Moffat scored goals about four minutes apart in the third period tonight to rally Winnipeg to a 32 victory over the Edmonton Oilers and move the Jets within a game of the World Hockey Association championship.

title: His Special Chair: Hundreds of Them
description: THE story began, according to David Utz, an antiques dealer, in February 1978 on a cold and rainy English day. At the end of a busy buying trip, Mr. Utz walked into an antiques furniture shop in London and sat down in a small goldpainted woven chair. It was so comfortable, he explained, that I stayed there for a couple of hours, and ended up by buying 30 similar chairs.

title: Constitution: A Campaign Issue the Voting Won't Resolve
description: OTTAWA, May 16  I want a government that can talk loudly and firmly for all of the country and that's what this campaign is all about.

title: Notes on People
description: What does Herbert A. Allen Jr., president of the Wall Street investment firm of Allen & Company, do when he sees a man running toward him with a gun?

title: Shot Driver Runs Into 2. Women
description: A Rutherford,,N.J., house painter was, fatally shot in the stomach when two men, apparently tried to rob him as he sat in his parked car in Manhattan yesterday afternoon. Attempting to escape his attackers by driving away, he lost control of the car and, hit two women on a park bench at 118th Street and Morningside Avenue, seriously injuring both, the police reported.

title: 2 Copiers Announced By Xerox
description: The Xerox Corporation announced two new copiers yesterday, an inexpensive desktop model and a mediumpriced machine that offers customers a size reduction capability.

title: LEGISLATOR ASSAILS RADIO FREE EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  A Rumanian pielate who has been accused of war crimes that took place 38 years ago was interviewed by the Americansponsored Radio Free Europe three weeks ago, prompting an inquiry this week by Representative Elizabeth Holtzman, Democrat of Brooklyn.

title: Disks: 'sweet Bands Evokes a Notable Era
description: SWEET BANDS OF THE 30'S., Five disks. Nostalgia Book Club 1006 (165 Huguenot Street, New Rochelle, N.Y.)

title: Money Supply Up in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, May 16 (UPI) Mexico's money, supply was up 35 percent in the first quarter of 1979 from its level in the comparable period of 1978, the Bank of Mexico said today.

title: Modern Museum's Plan For Building Advances
description: The Museum of Modern Art is close to signing a contract with a new developer for its longdelayed building expansion and 42story apartment tower, according to sources close to the museum. A previous arrangement with the Arlen Development Corporation, which had prepared extensive plans for the prpject, was terminated more than a yeafago.

title: The City
description: Two teamster officials were convicted yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan of conspiracy. bribereceiving and attempted grand larceny after a twoweek trial before Justice Budd G. Goodman.

title: MICHIGAN TO SUE U.S. ON CHEMICAL WASTES
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Attorney General of Michigan,testifying before a House subcommittee today, announced that he would file suit against the Environmental Protection Agency for doing virtually nothing to prevent poisonous chemical dumped at an Air Force base from contaminating ground water across four miles of lower Michigan.

title: The South: OldNew Land
description: Twentyfive years ago today, when the United States Supreme Court declared school segregation to be unconstitutional in the historic case of Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka, I was an 11yearold black Mississippian, and the Court seemed a remote institution that had little influence over our daytoday lives. Only the bravest teachers at our allblack public school dared discuss the decision in the classroom. The local press mentioned it only in terms of what they saw as its unsavory aspects; they feared it would destroy the Southern a segregated - way of life.

title: The New York Times /D. Gorton
description: IT'S a place of quiet to come back to. John. Granville was reflecting on his garden as he looked out toward it from his parlorfloor living room. The Bechtel crabapple was shrouded in palest pink. Just beyond. azaleas were bursting with rose and white flowers and the blue columbines had come into bloom.

title: Gold Price Climbs Again, Reaches Peak in London
description: LONDON, May 16  The price of gold charged to another record here today, with American speculators amone the main buyers.

title: Senator Church Sees Legislative Deal on Arms Pact
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  Senator Frank Church, the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, suggested today that one way of dealing with opposition to the SovietUnited States armslimitation treaty would be for the Senate to attach reservations acceptable to the two governments.

title: Both Albany Houses Agree to Curb Storage of Nuclear Waste Materials
description: ALBANY. May 16 - The Senate and Assembly announced agreement today on legislation designed to prohibit the storage of any additional nuclear wastes at West Valley without specific legislative authorization.

title: No Comment From Britons
description: LONDON, May 16  British ministers offered no comment today on the Senate's vote urging President Carter to lift economic sanctions against Rhodesia within 19 days of the installation of the new government in Salisbury.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday. May 16. 1979

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: 25 Years After Desegregation, North's Schools Lag
description: Every morning Hayward McCain, a 16yearold black youth, boards a bus near his home in the dense black enclave of North Philadelphia and rides 45 minutes to his high school downtown. At the same time, Gwendolyn Gorman, a 17yearold white girl who lives miles away in allwhite far northeast Philadelphia, is riding nearly two hours by bus and elevated train to the same school.

title: Talking Business
description: What will happen to the uranium industry if the utilities declare a moratorium on, or a complete end to, the building of nuclear power plants because of the accident at Three Mile Island?

title: Canadian and U.S. Preambles
description: Following are the preambles to the British North America Act of 1867, which established the Canadian federation, and to the Constitution of United States.

title: Polanski to Return For. Sentencing
description: CANNES, France, May 16 - Roman Polanski, whose notorious personal life is inextricably entwined with his career as a film director, confronted an aggressive mob of photographers and journalists here today to discuss his morals and his metier. That the ernphasis was on the morals, pursued by a press ostensibly concerned withcovering a film festival, demonstrated yet again the macabre public image that has haunted him since the grotesque murder of his wife, Sharon Tate, the actress, in 1969.

title: U.S. and Labor Battle Over Guidelines
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Carter Administration clashed In Federal court today with an unusual alliance of labor organizations and Republican Congressmen that is seeking to destroythe President's wage and price guidelines.

title: Calendar: A Tour ark Slope
description: Park Slope House Tour, Brooklyn.

title: Envoy to Switzerland Quits
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) President Carter has accepted the resignation of Marvin L. Warner, Ambassador to Switzerland, effective July 15, the White House said today. Mr. Warner, a Cincinnati real estate developer and fund raiser for the Democratic Party, was appointed by President Carter in 1977.

title: TRANSIT UNIT MOVES TO INCREASE SERVICE
description: Spurred by Governor Carey's warning that New York faces a possible gasoline shortage later this month, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority announced plans yesterday to expand its weekend bus and train service to accommodate riders who may switch from cars to public transportation on the two remaining weekends in May.

title: Last of Guyana Bodies Being Shipped to Coast
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., May 16 (UPI) - The last 100 bodies from the People's Temple in Guyana will be shipped to the San Francisco area this week, according to Charles Wyman, a State Department official.

title: Expulsion of Mastropieri Is Sought By Panel of New York City Council
description: The New York City Council's Ethics Committee unanimously recommended yesterday that Eugene F. Mastropieri be expelled from the Council after finding him guilty of 14 charges of misrepresentation, conflict of interest and misconduct.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Disarmament Commission  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Technology
description: ATHOUGH the plight of the automobile owner has received far more attention of late because of skyrocketing gasoline prices, it's the nation's truckers in fact who have been caught in the biggest squeeze on operating costs.

title: COMMODITIES
description: The price of gold for future delivery continued to soar on the New York Commodity Exchange yesterday, with contracts closing up $2.80 to $3.30 an ounce. The active nearJune Comex delivery finished at $258.70, up $2.90 on the day.

title: Air Merger Approved
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) The Civil Aeronautics Board, in its first decision on several pending airline merger cases, unanimously approved today the merger of North Central Airlines and Southern Airways into a new coasttocoast carrier.The new line, to be called Republic Airlines, still must receive approval from President Carter because international routes are involved. It would fly from Florida, Puerto Rico and the Cayman Islands in the south to Winnipeg and Thunder Bay, both in Canada, to the north, and from Boston to San Diego.

title: Falling Masonry Fatally Injures Barnard Student
description: An 18yearold Barnard College freshman out for a walk last night was killed by a chunk of masonry that fell from the seventh floor of a building near the campus.

title: An Age of Liberation
description: Twentyfive years ago, the Supreme Court's decision in Brown v. Board of Education looked important because of how it might change American education.

title: National's Holders Back a Merger Plan
description: MIAMI, May 16  Stockholders of National Airlines today approved overwhelmingly a contingency merger proposal that would guarantee them $50 a share if either Pan American World Airways or Eastern Air Lines acquired National.

title: Canada's Economic Slide Brings Stiff Campaign Fight for Trudeau
description: OTTAWA, May 16  Does it matter to an unemployed Canadian youth that young Briton or Frenchman is having even more trouble finding a job? Or to Canadian housewife that her Japanese counterpart is paying even more for food? The answer to these questions will help determine who will lead Canada for the next few years after the election of a new House of Commons on Tuesday.

title: Rhodesia, South Africa Hail Move In Senate to End Curb on Salisbury
description: CAPE TOWN, May 16  The Senate vote calling on President Carter to lift economic sanctions against Rhodesia was hailed by officials in Rhodesia and South Africa today as a breakthrough for the incoming blackmajority Government and as a major setback to the Rhodesian guerrilla forces fighting against Salisbury.

title: Immigration Inspectors Added
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) - An additional 81 inspectors will be on duty at United States ports of entry beginning July 1 to help detect illegal immigrants and counterfeit immigration documents, the Justice Department said today.

title: Music. Orchestre de Paris Opens Festival in Capital
description: WASHINGTON DANIEL BARENBOIM and the Orchestre de Paris Tuesday night started a fourday series at the Concert Hall of Kennedy Center that will take in major Berlioz works for chorus and orchestra. At the same time, in the Eisenhower Theater of Kennedy Center, the Comedie Francaise was holding forth in Victor Hugo's Ruy Blas. Also at the same time, in the Opera House of Kennedy Center, the Stuttgart Ballet was unveiling a new production of Lady of the Camellias, a fulllength work to music by Chopin.

title: EARNINGS
description: The General Foods Corporation reported yesterday that earnings in its final fiscal quarter were up 10 percent while those for the full year jumped 37 percent.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The nation's industrial output dropped 1 percent in April, the largest amount since 1975, while housing starts fell 2.1 percent, the Government reported. The Federal Reserve attributed the production decline to the teamster strike and lockout, but many private economists saw it as evidence of an economic slowdown. [D1.]

title: Goodyear Converts Old Rubber to New
description: AKRON, Ohio, May 16 (UPI)  The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company has developed a patented process using microwave energy to convert waste rubber almost poundforpound into new, highquality rubber.

title: Art: Cycladic Works At the National Gallery
description: WASHINGTON CYCLADIC Art from the Goulandris Collection at the National Gallery of Art in Washington is not a large exhibition, by the standards now current. But it is in more ways than one a pioneering venture of high quality.

title: Ballet: Miss Gregory in Debut as Lizzie in Fall River Legend
description: FROM the very early moment in Agnes de Mille's Fall River Legend Tuesday night when Cynthia Gregory stood by the galloWs, raised her hand and knocked her hat off, it was clear that her debut as Lizzie Borden in one of the most dramatic ballets of our time was going to be a thumph.

title: PARKING REGULATIONS
description: Alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations are in effect today, tomorrow and Saturday only in Brooklyn as part of a boroughbyborough rotation plan to clean up refuse during the tugboat strike. Next week, the regulations will go back into effect in the Bronx and be suspended in the other boroughs.

title: Guidry Wins, Fans 13
description: In a matchup that might have come straight from the files of Central Casting, two of the most celebrated pitchers in baseball stopped the show in comeback roles last night before a bewitched crowd of 43,843 spectators in Yankee Stadium.

title: Q&A
description: n My kitchen and dinette floor has Q. linoleum tiles cemented down on top of a tar paper (felt) floor covering. I find that even a dampmop cleanup causes some of these tiles to lift up if I use just a little too much water. I would like to install a new floor of vinylasbestos tile. Can I install this over the old tile by just cementing the new ones on top? - R.G.E., Red Hook, N.Y.

title: Moscow Ousting 2 Men From West German TV
description: MOSCOW, May 16 (Reuters)  A West German television cameraman, Herbert Altmann, said today that he and Robert Stengl, a reporter, were being expelled. Mr. Stengl is in West Germany on leave.

title: U.S. Expects Trade Pact To Reduce Inflation 0.5%
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Carter Administration, mounting a campaign to sell a new trade liberalization agreement to Congress, has distributed an analysis showing that the pact would bring about a reduction of at least onehalf percentage point in the annual American rate of inflation.

title: Wyszynski Visiting Vatican
description: ROME, May 16 (Reuters) - Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, the Roman Catholic Primate of Poland, arrived in Rome today to make final arrangements with Vatican officials for the visit by Pope John Paul II to Poland next month, Vatican sources said.

title: SisterPowered Energy Saver
description: When you've hurt your leg and can't get to school, it's the only way to travel. Kate Burton was unable to get from her home on Roosevelt Island to P.S. 59 in Manhattan, so she enlisted the muscle power of sister, Jenny, to wisk her along riverside paths to the tram. It was a lovely day to ride with top down, as temperatures reached 79 degrees.

title: CALIFORNIA RELAXES ITS POLLUTION LAW
description: SAN FRANCISCO. May 16 - Lieut. Gov. Mike Curb today signed an executive order easing antipollution rules to permit refineries in California to use more lead and more butane, which he said would let them make more gasoline.

title: Khomeini Sees a Need To Restrict Executions
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 16 (UPI) Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini said today that death sentences had to be restricted for Iran's economic revival, but he said there would be no mercy for traitors from the Shah's regime.

title: Rooms That Frame Photos
description: HAVING just seen designer rooms and designer table settings, one was not a bit suprised to view Interiors Designed for Photographs at the Light Gallery.

title: Breeding Nuclear Danger
description: If you are worried about the nuclear plants now use, wait till you see their planned successor, the breeder reactor. It could provide practically unlimited energy  but at the risk of a truly devastating accident and a faster spread of nuclear weapons. President Carter has wisely tried to scuttle the proposed Clinch River breeder reactor, a demonstration plant designed to speed early commercialization of breeder technology. But Congress refuses to let the project die. That seems especially reckless in the wake of Three Mile Island. The nation is just beginning to reassess the safety of existing reactors. This is no time to plunge into new technologies that are, in the President's words, potentially dangerous, unproven and unnecessary.

title: Mortgage Firm Fails to Pay
description: A Denver mortgage firm yesterday failed to pay for a purchase of mortgagebacked securities estimated at $350 million.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: BLUE KOCHI (North America West African LinesAtlantic Oversees Corporation). Monrovia May 30, Abidian June 2. Lome 4 Cotonou 6, Lagos 7 and Port Harcourt 9; sails from Clinton Avenue. Brooklyn HAMLET ARABIA (Saudi National LinesCosta Line Cargo Services). Aqaba June 5, Jidda 9 and Port Sudan 12; sails from Kane Street. Brooklyn.
