The laws that control the concentration of huge structures now being shoehorned into a small part of midtown Manhattan are setting an alarming pattern of development. The density that the new buildings promise for the future also threatens some of the city's best blocks and buildings.

title: Purchasers See 79 Gain In Business
description: Most purchasing agents  the people who buy raw materials for industry and maintain supply stockpiles  seem convinced that business will be better this year than last but that the pace of any advance will continue to slow.

title: Air Freight Unit Expands
description: Burlington Northern Air Freight, the air cargo subsidiary of Burlington Northern Railroad, said yesterday that it was adding facilities in Norfolk, Va., New Orleans and Allentown, Pa. This brings the company's air freight facilities to more than 90.

title: Going Out Guide
description: THE WOMEN A sixconcert panoramic survey of multimedia music by female composers, past and present, starts tonight at 8 o'clock the campus theater of City Universities La Guardia Community College, 3110 Thomson Avenue in Long Island City, Queens, at the foot of the Queensboro Bridge.

title: Events
description: Music

title: Deaths
description: GILBHoward W. 78, President of the National Bakery Division of the Atlantic and Pacific Tea company from 19391965, former resident of Larchmont NY, died on May 21, 1979 at his home In Santa Barbara, Cal. Never sought honors: yet honors pursued him. A born leader whose kindliness and charity made him stand high amongst his fellow man. Survived by his wife, Dorothy P. Glib, and four children Howard J. Glib, Roy L. Glib, Dorothy E. Varisco and Patricia R. Cory and twelve grandchildren. Funeral mass. Friday. May 25 1979 at 10am Sts. John and Paul's Roman Catholic Church. 280 Weaver St, Larchmont NY. Interment Gate of Heaven Cemetery Valhalla. Funeral director Fox Funeral Home Larchmont NY. In lieu of flowers, family suggests donations in Howard W. Glib's memory be made to a charity of their own choice.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, May 23  Up to 85 percent of Connecticut's 3,100 service stations will be closed on Sunday and Monday, but the remainder have budgeted their monthly allocations to leave enough gasoline on hand for limited purchases during at least a few hours on those days, state and automobileclub officials said today. They predicted only inconvenience and spotty droughts, and saw no disaster.

title: Deaths
description: IMMERMAN Henrietta. Beloved wife of the late Arthur. Loving mother of Sholom, Stanley, Sid, Zack and Paul and devoted motherinlaw. Cherished sister of Anne Greene, Betty Marks, Sylvia Barnett and Paul Miller. Adored grandmother and greatgrandmother. Services Friday 2:30PM at Gutterman's Nassau Memorial Chapel Long Beach Road at Greystone, Rockville Centre, LI.

title: OneYear Bills Sold at 9.153%
description: The Treasury auctioned oneyear bills yesterday at an average yield of 9.153 percent, down from the previous sale of 9.235 percent.

title: Gas Find Reported Off Jersey
description: Tenneco Inc. announced yesterday that it had found natural gas in the Baltimore Canyon off New Jersey at a well not far from where Texaco Inc. discovered gas last August. The new find, which follows the withdrawal of several companies from the area in recent months, rekindled hope that this offshore site might some day supply fuel for the Northeast.

title: Cardinals, 3 PhiHies 1
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 23 (AP)  The St. Louis Cardinals followed stolen bases with runscoring hits three times  by Keith Hernandez, Garry Templeton and Ken Reitz  and defeated the Philadelphia Phillies, 31, tonight in a raindelayed game.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: BOSTON, May 23  In the next three weeks President Carter has to make one of his most difficult foreignpolicy decisions: whether to end sanctions against Rhodesia. Why is it so hard? Why should he not simply follow the Senate's advice and welcome the new Salisbury Government about to be formed under a first black Prime Minister, Bishop Abel Muzorewa?

title: LANCE AND 3 OTHERS ARE INDICTED BY U.S. IN BANK CONSPIRACY
description: ATLANTA, May 23  A Federal grand jury charged today that Bert Lance, former director of the Office of Management and Budget, and three business associates conspired to file false statements, mislead Government regulatory agencies and misapply bank funds to obtain $20 million in loans for their own benefit from at least 41 banks from 1970 to 1978.

title: The Region
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I. (UPI)  One of two men captured last October in a sailboat containing seven tons of marijuana has been sentenced to one year in the Suffolk County jail.

title: Mets, Rained Out, Use Zachry Tonight
description: The Mets formally reclaimed Pat Zachry from the disabled list and sent Dwight Bernard back to the minor leagues last night as Joe Torre continued to reshuffle his injured and inexperienced pitching staff.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets continued to rally yesterday as speculation spread that the economy might be heading into recession that would reduce the demand for borrowed funds and permit the Federal Reserve to encourage lower interest rates.

title: China Raises Remains Of Ship Sunk in 1945
description: TOKYO, May 23 (AP)  China has recovered the remains of 158 persons from among 2,000 who died when an American submarine sank the Japa. nese ship Awa Maru at the end of World War II.

title: Deaths
description: SCHIFFLawrence. We mourn the cussing of our esteemed member. Unity Club of Bklyn Charles Rockrnore, President Daniel M. Cohen, Secsy

title: Volkswagen of Mexico Making a Lot of Money
description: MEXICO CITY, May 23  Less than three years ago, Volkswagen was thinking of closing its $80 million production plant in Mexico. The wholly owned subsidiary had been caught by the August 1976 devaluation of the Mexican peso with large dollar commitments and, in the words of management, we were broke.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: MULLIGAN STEW. By Gilbert Sorrentino. 445 pages. Grove Press. S14.95

title: Shakespeare Items To Tour Six Cities
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  A collection of artifacts from Shakespeare's time, including the First Folio published in 1623 and the Adams model of the Globe playhouse, will tour six American cities, including New York, over the next two years, the Folger Shakespeare Library announced yesterday.

title: CORRECTION
description: The obituary of Robert D. Heinl Jr., a retired Marine colonel, that appeared in The Times on May 7 reported incorrectly that he had been forced to resign from the Marine Corps after a conflict with the Pentagon over an article he had written about Haiti. Colonel Heinl refused to resign and was permitted to reture for reasons of health.

title: Rhodesians Create a Senate
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 23 (UPI)  The predominantly black House of Assembly today created a Senate. The 10 black members all belong to Prime Ministerelect Abel Muzorewa's party. Five candidates put up by the United National Federal Party were defeated. The Senate election was boycotted by the Rev. Ndabaningi Sithole's party, which has called for last month's election to be declared void. The 10 white members were being elected by the 28 white Assembly members, all members of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith's party.

title: DR. GUNNAR.GUNDERSEN
description: LA CROSSE, Wis., May 23 (AP)  Dr. Gunnar Gundersen, president of the American Medical Association from 1958 to 1959, died yesterday. He was 82 years old.

title: SOVIET ARMY LINKED TO U.S.AIDED PLANT
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  United States intelligence officials said today that a Soviet truckmanufacturing plant built with American help was producing eneines for military vehicles.

title: A QUIET ARCHBISHOP IN POPE'S OLD POST
description: CRACOW, Poland  It has been seven months since Karol Cardinal Wojtyla left the ancient see of Cracow to become Pope John Paul II and four months since his confidant, Msgr. Franciszek Macharski, succeeded him as Archbishop.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I recently replaced the mechy anism inside my toilet tank and decided to install a flapper valve. I have not been able to adjust this properly. It seals well, but about 20 to 40 percent of the time it closes quickly, without allowing all the water to run out of the tank and flush the bowl properly. I have tried three manufacturers valves, changing the position so that it faces the inlet valve, but to no avail. I have checked the overflow pipe to make sure it is vertical and not offcenter. Do you have any suggestions to offer?S.C., Cherry Hill, N.J.

title: Deaths
description: COLEMANChristoptier G. of Mamaroneck NY on May 21, 1979. Beloved husband of Emma (Harrington) Coleman Dear father of Elizabeth Benz, Rosemary Hagerty, Bernadette Scanlon, Lucille Ricerdella and Eileen Coleman. Also survived by eight grandchildren. RePosing at Lloyd Maxey Beauchamp Chapel, Shea Place, New Rochelle. Mass of Christian Burial, Holy Trinity Church, Mamaroneck Friday 10 AM. Interment Holy Name Cemetery, Ofisville N.Y. Visiting hours 25 and 79 pm.

title: EARNINGS Federated Up 11.5%; Carter Hawley Gains
description: Federated Department Stores, the nation's largest department store chain, which includes Bloomingdale's and Abraham & Straus in New York, reported yesterday that it had an 11.5 percent rise in net income for the 13 weeks to May 5 to $28.1 million, or 58 cents a share, from $25.2 million, or 52 cents a share, for the comparable 13 weeks to April 29. 1978.

title: High Court Makes Warden Smile in Wake of Problems
description: Life is not uneventful for a prison warden, but these have been especially busy days for Dale Thomas, the warden of the Federal jail on Foley Square in lower Manhattan.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Executive Upheld on Job Switch
description: CALGARY, Alberta, May 23  The right of an employee to change jobs without running the risk of legal action by his former employer has been upheld by the trial division of the Alberta Supreme Court.

title: Associated Press
description: ABSENT TEXAS SENATORS JOIN COLLEAGUES: Yesterday, the 12 Killer Bees, those senators who boycotted the Texas Senate for five days, rejoined their colleagues for the opening prayer. Among the words of Chaplain Gerald Mann were, Let us remember that one of the great lessons of history is that the bee always fertilizes the flower it robs: The 12 legislators, Democrats, wanted to kill a bill calling for Presidential primary.

title: American Arts Academy In Annual Honors to 63
description: With the writer Barbara W. Tuchman presiding over the proceedings, the American Academy of Arts and Letters yesterday honored 63 artists, architects, composers and writers. The 39th such annual event, it took place at the headquarters of the AcademyInstitute at 633 West 155th Street, now a historical landmark.

title: Backgammon:
description: In the heat of battle a player may lose his nerve and fail to take a certain course of action  even though he knows it to be theoretically correct. Postponing a dangerous but necessary play will be likely to increase the overall risk. In such situations one should be guided by Macbeth's admonition: If it were done, when tis done, then twere well it were done quickly.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Leo W. Ladehoff, who was hired by Dayton Malleable Inc. as its president last December, was elected yesterday to the additional post of chief executive officer. He succeeds John F. Torley, 68 years old, who will remain chairman.

title: Middle Atlantic
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 23  Travelers on the main highways and in major resort areas of Pennsylvania, Virginia, Maryland and Delaware will generally be able to find adequate supplies of gasoline, according to officials in the four states.

title: Simplified Wagering Not So Simple
description: The computerized ABS (All Betting Simplified) wagering system was introduced as Belmont Park Opened a 60day meeting yesterday, but it served only to complicate things for the 15,715 bettors and spectators.

title: COMMODES
description: The recordsmashing advance in precious metals prices came to a halt yesterday as some large commission houses advised their customers to convert part of their recent large paper profits into cash.

title: New England
description: BOSTON, May 23 Motorists will have to do a little looking for their gasoline in Massachusetts and Maine over the Memorial Day weekend, while New Hampshire and Vermont expect virtually no abnormal closings of gas stations, officials said today.

title: Long Island
description: BAYVILLE, L.I., May 23  Although 70 percent of Long Island service stations are expected to be closed this weekend. state and local officials say that an emergency allocation of gasoline for the eastern end of the island will assure motorists heading for resort areas of enough gasoline to last through the threeday holiday.

title: ExNazi Voted West German President
description: BONN, May 23  Karl Carstens, the Christian Democratic Speaker of the lower house of Parliament and a former member of the Nazi Party, was elected President of West Germany today. His nomination had divided the country.

title: CBS, Slow and Steady, Aims at No.1
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23  The current giant pep rally  officially known as the CBS Affiliates Conference  has as its slogan Looking Good.

title: Egypt and Israel Report Delay in Opening Border
description: TEL AVIV, May 23  Egypt and Israel announced today that their new frontier would remain closed after the Israeli withdrawal on Friday from El Arish in northern Sinai.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Advertising
description: Mennen's Fragrant Millionaire

title: LIBERAL DEMOCRATS SPUR HOUSE DEFEAT OF FEDERAL BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Liberal Democrats, angered by cuts in educational and social programs, soundly defeated the proposed Federal budget in the House of Representatives today and forced the Senate to increase spending authority for domestic programs.

title: Insider Reports for Exchanges
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanees.

title: Sketches of the Three Indicted With Lance
description: ATLANTA, May 23  Following is information about the careers of the three men indicted along with Bert Lance, former Presidential adviser:

title: Diplomats Win in Soccer
description: BOSTON, May 23 (AP)  Tommy O'Hara and Bobby Stokes scored midway in the game to give Washington a lead it never lost tonight as the Diplomats defeated the New England Tea Men. 31, in the rain in North American Soccer League play. The attendance of 1,446 at Boston University's Nickerson Field was smallest ever at a Tea Men home game.

title: Hongisto Under Criticism For Support of Prison Bill
description: ALBANY, May 23  In the last day of hearings on the confirmation of Richard D. Hongisto, Governor Carey's nominee for Correction Commissioner, Republicans asserted that Mr. Hongisto, by supporting a bill that could put more prison inmates in private community facilities, was contradicting testimony he gave last month.

title: Physicist Describes Risk In Bomb Data Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  A nuclear physicist told a Senate subcommittee today that the Government's erroneous declassification of a document describing the basic principles of hydrogen bombs, making it available to the public for almost four years, was the most serious breach of security I am aware of in this country's postWorld War II nuclear weapons development programs.

title: Handmade Crafts by Theater Artists
description: IT'S an impressive cast. The roster of names posted on the citrine brick wall reads like a theater production  David Toser, costume designer; Torn Klunis, actor; Charlotte Westcott and Louise Larabee, actresses, and a supporting cast of backstage hands too numerous to mention. But these theater and media artists are gaining public exposure in alternate professions, amid a potpourri of handmade crafts sold in the Performer's Outlet at 222 East 85th Street.

title: Concert: Tod Machover
description: TOD MACHOVER seems to be a young man in a hurry. Born in New York in 1953, he has already earned two degrees from the Juilliard School, studied musical composition in Italy, attended Columbia University and the University of California, done work in computer music at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, spent a season as principal cellist of the National Opera of Canada, been a composerinresidence at the Pompidou Center in Paris and had a fullevening concert of his works performed at Alice Tully Hall by the Contemporary Chamber Ensemble and several guest artists.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: RACHLINIrvIng. Beloved husband of Blanche. Devoted father of Ater and Henry. Loving brother of muel S. Rachlin, Bess Goodman anc Ann Grant. Services Friday, 9:45 am, Riverside, 180W. 76 St.

title: Textbook Approach To Home Budgeting
description: SOME people find that one way to save money is to spend some of it for courses in planning an effective budget or in investing surplus cash. A number of schools in the metropolitan area offer such courses:

title: Stevedore and Union Aide Are Guilty in Loan Case
description: The owner of a major waterfront company and an official of the International Longshoremen's Association were convicted yesterday on Federal charges that the company had made $68,000 in illegal loans to the union official in violation of the TaftHartley Act.

title: Around the Nation
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 23 (AP)  A rift dating to the Civil War was narrowed last night when members of the two largest denominations of the Presbyterian Church took communion at a joint worship service.

title: Stock Market Averages Retreat
description: Weakness in automotive and other industrial issues sent the popular stockmarket averages into retreat yesterday. Prices posted a progressive decline after opening higher.

title: Louise Benton Wed To Ralph Wagner
description: Louise Hemingway Benton and Ralph C. Wagner were married yesterday in the chapel of the Congregational Church in Southport, Conn. The Rev. Loring Ensign, the minister, and the Rev. Francis X. Cheney, former rector of Trinity Episcopal Church in Southport, performed the ceremony.

title: Mayor Forms Design Industry Council
description: The Office of Economic Development of the City of New York sponsored the first meeting yesterday of the Mayor's Advisory Council for the Interior Furnishings and Design Industry at City Hall.

title: Last Class Leaves Cornell Nursing School
description: The Cornell UniversityNew York Hospital School of Nursing graduated its final class yesterday, ending a 103year history of preparing young women and men for careers as nurses.

title: Galletta's 68 for 213 Captures L. I. Open
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., May 23  Mal Galletta of the Glen Cove Golf Club shot a twounderpar 68 in the final round today to win the 77th annual Long Island open at the St. George's Golf and Country Club.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Yachts Reign As Status Symbols at Film Festival
description: CANNES, France, May 23  This will be remembered as the Year of the. Yacht at the 32d Cannes Film Festival, yachts being the ultimate status symbol here, well overshadowing the 3200aday suites in which producers hide out at the Hotel du Cap in nearby Cap d'Antibes.

title: Salvador Official Is Assassinated And Leader Orders State of Siege
description: SAN SALVADOR, May 23 (AP)  The Minister of Education and his chauffeur were assassinated today, and President Carlos Humberto Romero later imposed a state of siege to help his military backed Government deal with a growing wave of violence that has left 80 people dead and more than 100 injured in the last three weeks.

title: Iranian Oil Output
description: TEHRAN, May 23 (UPI)  Iran's production of crude oil averaged 4.1 million barrels a day during the month ended May 21, the country's official news agency said today, and exports averaged 3.4 million barrels a day.

title: Where the Bargains Are: Thrift and Junk Shops
description: PUTTING to use the things other people have discarded is a challenge to one's Ingenuity as well as a strangely harmonious form of regeneration. I like the stamp that former ownership gives possessions. Puttering around in obscure shops that advertise collectibles, where the wares make only the feeblest pretense of being antiques, remains my favorite avocation. What is more relaxing than an afternoon of thrift shoos. a weekend of yard sales?

title: Associated Press
description: CHEERS AND TEARS: Members of the Grand Canyon College baseball team celebrate clinching of Area 2 N.A.I.A. championship last Friday with a champagne party. They learned yesterday that they had been barred from playing in the N.A.I.A. World Series because their college, which is owned by the Baptist Church, forbids possession of alcoholic beverages.

title: U.S. Steel's Cleanup: Cost Put at $25 a Ton
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  The United States Steel Corporation's agreement with the Federal Government to spend $400 million over the next three and a half years to clean up air and water pollution will add about $25 a ton to the cost of producing steel by the end of 1982, the company said today.

title: Walinsky Appointed by Governor To Head the Investigation Panel
description: ALBANY, May 23  Governor Carey named Adam Walinsky, a lawyer from Scarsdale, as chairman of the bipartisan State Commission of Investigation yesterday. Mr. Walinsky would succeed Eric A. Self f, whose term expired April 30.

title: Hospital Workers Stage City Hall Demonstration
description: An estimated 2,500 workers from New York City voluntary hospitals demonstrated at City Hall yesterday against threatened cutbacks.

title: Stage: Pearl Diver In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Carter Offers Welfare Revisions; Would Cut Costs in This Region
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  President Caper today sent Congress a longawaited, scaleddown package of welfare revisions designed to raise and broaden benefits in some states, ease the local welfare costs in other states and create more than 400.000 new lobs for those on relief.

title: Conspiracy Count Is Central in Lance Case
description: ATLANTA, May 23  Today's indictment of Bert Lance and three associates weaves together nine years of technical and complicated banking transactions, through a sweeping conspiracy count, into one of the widestranging bank fraud

title: Concert: StarChild
description: TUESDAY night at Carnegie Hall, George Crumb's grandly ambitious StarChild was performed by the Philadelphia Orchestra, somewhat changed from the original version heard in its premiere by the New York Philharmonic two seasons ago. This sixsection piece, subtitled A Parable for Soprano, Antiphonal Children's Voices, Male Speaking Choir With Handbells and Large Orchestra, made a far more powerful impression this time, partly because Carnegie Hall had a gentling effect on Mr. Crumb's earflattening fortissimos in the Musica Apocalyptica part, which had been merely loudly ugly in the Philharmonic performance under Pierre Boulez.

title: House Panel Is Told of Radiation In Idaho and Montana Buildings
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  A House panel was told today that thousands of buildings in Idaho and Montana were emitting potentially dangerous levels of radiation because they were at least partly constructed with phosphate slag, a building material that contains minute amounts of radium.

title: Statement by Clark Indicates Likely Goals
description: TORONTO, May 23  I think there are very real limits on what a Government can do, said Joe Clark, the head of Canada's Progressive Conservative Party, during the election campaign.

title: Soviet Says Chinese Killed Two
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (Reuters)  Maj. Gen. Vasily V. Gaponenko, chief political commissar of the border guards, says that two Soviet soldiers have been killed by Chinese agents infiltrating across the border. Writing in Partiinaya Zhizn, a Communist Party monthly, the general cited the case of a sergeant and two privates who were decorated for intercepting infiltrators, and said the two dead soldiers had been decorated posthumously. No other details were given.

title: Florida Aide Pressing for Slayer's Quick Execution
description: STARKE, Fla., May 23 (AP)  Florida's Attorney General, Jim Smith, surprised by two stays of execution won by John A. Spenkelink, vowed today to see that the murderer was executed before his death warrant expires at noon Friday.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, May 23.1979

title: U.S. Cuts TradeGain Forecast
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  The Carter Administration told Congress today that it had revised sharply downward its forecast of trade improvement for this year. The reason is the rise in world oil prices.

title: Concert: Bronstein and Lorenz Duo
description: ENA BRONSTEIN and Philip Lorenz formed an excellent twopiano team when they appeared in New York eight years ago and were married. No longer wife and husband, they still make fine musical partners, as shown in their concert at the 92d Street Y on Tuesday night.

title: Stage: Up in One Opens
description: PETER ALLEN has been around for awhile. He was known as a youthful performer from Australia, as Liza Minnelli's husband and exhusband, and most significantly as the finest composer and performer to emerge from the cabaret scene in New York in the earlymid 1970's.

title: Cosmos to Get $600,000 for Releasing Cruyff
description: EAST RLTTHERFORD, N. .1., May 23  Operating as effectively in the front office as Giorgio Chinaglia does in front of the goal, the Cosmos revealed today that they would receive $600,000 as compensation for the Los Angeles Aztecs signing of Johan Cruyff yesterday, even though Cruyff was never Cosmos property.

title: SoulRock: Millie Jackson Sings and Talks
description: MMILLIE JACKSON'S career has grown slowly but steadily since her debut as a recording artist in the early 70's, and her abilities have grown along with it. On record, she developed her persona  the worldly, outspoken, anround natural woman  early on, but as recently as 1975, she was still a tentative stage performer who tended to stand rooted in one spot while she recited her narrative of ihfidelilty, dispensed her liberated advice and employed her dark, smoky voice magnificently on a canny selection of soul, pop and even country songs.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Tidrow Sent to Cubs for Burris
description: DETROIT, May 23  The Yankees traded Dick Tidrow to the Chicago Cubs today in a straight exchange for Ray Burris, also a righthanded pitcher.

title: Brewers 1, Angels 0
description: MILWAUKEE, May 23 (AP)  Paul Molitor scored on Don Aase's basesloaded wild pitch with two out in the seventh inning for the only run as the Milwaukee Brewers beat the California Angels, 10, tonight behind Bill Travers's sixhit pitching.

title: Victorious Clark Moves To Take Reins in Canada
description: OTTAWA, May 23  After an election victory yesterday for the Progressive Conservative Party that gave Joe Clark only a precarious hold on Parliament, he prepared today to govern a profoundly divided country.

title: Hers
description: WHEN I hear a small hand picking out Fiir Elise on the piano in that muzzy hour before dinner is laid cm the table, as once my own hand did, I begin to believe that I may have stumbled into a continuum. When I see a stance, a toss of hair and thrust of chin as once I tossed and thrust, I feel that I may have made a perpetual motion. And when I hear adolescent accusa. tions of my foreignness, as once my own mouth spoke them,! think that I may have gotten a jump on science and cloned myself. That I did not, or would rot, recognize my parents in myself, and therefore did DM anticipate what I see in my children, is probably not relevant. Better now than not at all.

title: The Cardboard Solution Is Light, Strong and Cheap
description: The New York Times/ Robert Levin

title: S.E.C. Staff Cites Firm
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  The Securities and Exchange Commission staff today accused New Yorkbased First Jersey Securities Inc. and nine of its associates of violating antifraud and other provisions of the securities laws.

title: Topics
description: Lust for Unanimity

title: CONGRESS OIL STUDY DISPUTES PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  The Congressional Budget Office asserted today that President Carter's plan to remove price controls from crude oil would result in less conservation and less output of oil than the Administration had projected and would provide even bigger profits to oil companies than had been forecast.

title: Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 23  A spokesman for the East Hudson Parkway Authority, which operates the Westchester County parkways, said today that service stations on the Saw Mill River, Hutchinson and Taconic Parkways would observe the following schedules for the Memorial Day weekend:

title: World News Briefs
description: EAST BERLIN, May 23  East Germany, in another step in its campaign against dissident intellectuals, has imposed a $4,500 fine on Stefan Heym, one of the country's leading novelists, for publication of a book in the West without authorization.

title: New Shange Choreopoem To Be Given at the Public
description: Spell #7: A Geechee Quick Magic Trance Manual, a new choreopoem by Ntozake Shange, will be performed this week and next at the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater at 425 Lafayette Street.

title: Revlon Raises Dividend
description: Revlon Inc. said yesterday that its board of directors had voted to increase the quarterly common stock dividend to 39 cents a share from 32 cents, payable July 16 to holders of record June 15.

title: Utility Believes It Is Safe To Dump Reactor Water
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI)  The president of the utility that operates Three Mile Island's crippled nuclear reactor told Congress today that he was certain 500,000 gallons of contaminated water could be dumped safely into the Susquehanna River.

title: U.N. Manila Talks Seem Stalled
description: MANILA, May 23 (Reuters)  The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development, which has spent two and a half weeks here trying to devise a way of closing the gap between the wealthy and developing nations, appeared to be stalled today. Thirdworld countries were said to be split over energy problems, and the rich nations were divided over the issue of protectionism. The meeting is scheduled to end next week.

title: Bush Is Buoyed by Iowa Straw Poll
description: CHICAGO, May 23  George Bush, an announced candidate for the Republican Presidential nomination, arrived here today for a speaking engagement considerably buoyed by a straw poll taken at an Iowa statewide Republican dinner that showed him with a substantial lead over field of hopefuls that included Ronald Reagan, the former California Governor.

title: Medal for John Wayne Approved by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)  Congress sent President Carter legislation today to have a special gold medal struck in honor of John Wayne, the actor.

title: Coast Police Assail Restraint Order in Riot
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 23  The San Francisco Police Officers Association accused the chief of police today of permitting a homosexual riot to get out of control Monday night, and Police Chief Charles Gain responded that we would have had a police riot if restraint had not been imposed by police commanders.

title: Privately Held Company Sells Bonds to the Public
description: A small privately held company sold $14 million in bonds to public investors yesterday in an unusual financing that could pave the way for other private companies to tap the public debt markets.

title: A Halt to Funds For Paper Voted At City College
description: Students at the City College in New York voted late Tuesday night to cut off financing of The Observation Post, a campus newspaper, after the editors had published photographs of a woman dressed as a nun masturbating with a crucifix.

title: The City
description: Three tugs chartered by the city and operated by ferry boat personnel began yesterday to move garbageladen barges from two Brooklyn transfer terminals to the Fresh Kills landfill in Staten Island as the strike of conunercial tugboat crewmen went through its 53d day.

title: VIRUS LINK IS FOUND IN DIABETES PATIENT
description: In the first thoroughly documented instance of its kind, a virus has been linked to a fatal case of diabetes under circumstances that make it almost certain that the virus caused the disease.

title: A Chrononlogy of Events in Career of Bert Lance
description: ATLANTA, May 23 (AP)  Following is a summary of events in the business and political life of former Federal Budget Director Bert Lance.

title: U.S. Objects to Buzzing Of 2 Warships by Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters) Soviet planes have harassed American ships in the Arabian Sea three times in a week, prompting an official United States Navy protest, Government sources reported today.

title: Yanks Lose to Tigers, 43, in 9th As a Pitch by Kaat Nicks Batter
description: DETROIT, May 23  The record book has no mind and no heart and will simply record the cold fact that the Detroit Tigers defeated the New York Yankees by a 43 score tonight.

title: A Guide to Buying Carpets at a Discount
description: LOW prices, designer carpets and immediate delivery are good reasons for shopping at discount carpet houses specializing in mill ends and odd lots. Situated in lowrent districts where large inventories can be inexpensively maintained, these places are the dumping grounds for decorator colors that didn't sell well, remainders from large custom orders and, very often, surplus yardage of current styles that cost twice as much in retail stores.

title: Leeds &
description: The Leeds & Northrup division of the General Signal Corporation said yesterday that it had been awarded a $27.6 million contract by the State Electricity Commission of Victoria, Australia, for instrumentation and computer systems for a new generating facility powered by fossil fuel at LoyYang, about 150 miles from Melbourne.

title: Lawrence Schiff, 82, the Founder And Once President of Silk Mills
description: Lawrence Schiff, founder and former president of the Lawrence Schiff Silk Mills, died Tuesday at the Jewish Hospital and Medical Center in Brooklyn following a brief illness. He was 82 years old and had lived in Palm Beach, Fla., since his retirement in 1969.

title: Rhodesia's U.S. Senate
description: To many Africans it was always clear that the Senate never did have much stomach for the radical shifts that the Administration sought to bring to American policy on southern Africa. Both Rhodesia's outgoing Prime Minister, Ian D.Smith, and the South African Government knew this and have consistently exploited this knowledge to the full.

title: A Little Clown Under the Big Top
description: Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus held tryouts for new clowns in Madison Square Garden yesterday. The youngest to try was Sandy Kotz, 6, from Detroit. Under the guidance of George Rollins, a veteran circus clown, Sandy feigned a gag balancing act, complete with umbrella and tight rope.

title: Furniture Bargains At Clearance Outlets
description: WHILE it may not be chic to shop at furniture clearance centers, stocked with last season's floor samples and styles that were (often deservedly) discontinued, energetic bargain hunters may find a pearl in these clam beds.

title: South Africa Quietly Slips Into Its U.N. Assembly Seat
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 23 South Africa today reoccupied its seat in the General Assembly, which had been vacant since 1974 when the country was suspended for its race policies.

title: Sound
description: ABSOLUTELY great! exclaimed the producer when he heard the tape just rushed to him from the studio. Two months later, the finished disk of the same performance reached him from the pressing plant. Eagerly he put it on the turntable. Then his face fell. Absolutev awful. he said.

title: Braves 6, Astros 5
description: ATLANTA, Mayt 23 (AP)  Jerry Royster's tworun single, a wild pitch and a throwing error highlighted a fiverun eighth inning and carried the Atlanta Braves to a 65 victory over the Houston Astros tonight.

title: Democratic Chairman Assails DraftKennedy Move Led by Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  John C. White, the Democratic national chairman, today denounced draftKennedy efforts as likely to promote party discord that would hand over the Presidency on a silver platter to the Republicans.

title: Home Improvement
description: Make the Effort to Set Flagstones in Concrete

title: Technology
description: Small Inventors Find Big Help

title: Scherman Memorial on Tuesday
description: A memorial service for Thomas K. Scherman, founder and conductor of the Little Orchestra Society, who died May 14, will be held at the Bruno Walter Auditorium in the Lincoln Center LibraryMuseum at noon Tuesday. Arnold Weissberger and Howard Shanet will be the speakers.

title: A New Leader Over the Border
description: TORONTO, May 23  In one of his early, determined political campaigns, a young man from Alberta named Joe Clark sought to turn voter unfamiliarity with his name to his advantage.

title: Expos 3, Pirates 0
description: MONTREAL, May 23 (UPI)  Steve Rogers tossed an eighthitter and the Montreal Expos, playing their first night game at home this season, defeated the Pittsburgh Pirates, 30.

title: The Joy of Living In Secondhand Style
description: WHEN I was new I wanted new things, although wanted does not convey the passion with which ripped the cellophane off sock pack. ages with my teeth, buried my nose in the soft flannel folds of my first Lanz dress, nabbed satin hair ribbons across my upper lip, and tossed discontentedly on unironed sheets, dreaming of the canopy bed that my parents didn't think was crucial to my spiritual development,

title: Blue Mitchell, 49, Jazzman, Dies; A Trumpeter With Horace Silver
description: Richard A. (Blue) Mitchell, the trumpet player, died of cancer at his home in Los Angeles on Monday. He was 49 years old.

title: Virginia Tanner, Led Children's Dance Group
description: Virginia Tanner, a pioneer in children's dance education, died Saturday at her home in Salt Lake City. She was 64 years old.

title: Overtime to Help Keep Police Patrols at Strength
description: The Police Department will pay overtime to offset a temporary dip of several hundred in the number of police officers patrolling the streets, Police Commissioner Robert J. McGuire said yesterday.

title: They Cheered the Umpires
description: When the real umpires came back to work, they got standing ovations. That's got to be unprecedented in the history of organized baseball. It has to set the season of 1979 apart from all others. Now and then an umpire's wife will speak well of him. Probably his.children do sometimes, and on rare occasions an individual ballplayer or even a manager may drop a kind word, if he's pretty sure nobody will overhear. But the fans? They cheer when the umpire is flattened by a foul tip.

title: HELPFULHARDWARE
description: ASIMPLE, inexpensive hook can solve a weighty hanging problem if you know what. to ask for at your hardware store. The right hook for the right wall surface almost always exists. The following six hooks are useful, unobtrusive and stay put once attached.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Canada Divided
description: Some will be tempted to link the Progressive Conservative victory in Canada with a worldwide trend toward conservatism  in New Zealand, Australia, Sweden and, only three weeks ago, Britain. Even if such a trend exists, and we suspect it is only optical, it cannot embrace the Canadian results. For one thing, what kind of ideological victory is it when the Liberals win the popular vote by 500,000? For another thing, the election was decided by issues of language, culture and history, not economic ideology.

title: Texas Bill Would Raise Home Mortgages to 12%
description: The Texas Legislature passed a bill yesterday that would allow interest rates on home mortages to rise as high as 12 percent from the present limit of 10 percent set by the state's Constitution.

title: Vornado Denies Plan To Sell Two Guys
description: Frederick Zissu, chairman of Vornado Inc., denied that the company planned to sell any of its Two Guys discount department stores in New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Connecticut and Massachusetts.

title: 20,000 Said to Flee Afghanistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 23 (Reuters)  Some 20,000 Afghan villagers have fled to Pakistan this month to escape fighting between insurgents and forces of the proCommunist regime in Kabul, informed sources said today.

title: Onondaga County Attorney. Fined and Put on Probation
description: SYRACUSE, May 23  Ralph Greenhouse, who resigned as Onondaga County Attorney last night, was sentenced today to one year's probation and was ordered to pay $11,100 in fines for his participation in a conspiracy to solicit campaign contributions unlawfully from public employees.

title: Defendant in Arson Fatal to 6 Firefighters Reportedly Confessed
description: After a fellow inmate at Rikers Island implicated Eric Jackson in arson at a Brooklyn supermarket in which six firemen died last summer, Mr. Jackson confessed to the crime, lawenforcement officials close to the case said yesterday. They also said Mr. Jackson had identified two accomplices and a businessman he said had paid $1,500 to have the fire set.

title: U.S.BRITISH PARLEY ENDS HARMONIOUSLY
description: LONDON, May 23  The United States and the new British Government concluded three days of consultations on a harmonious note today, but with no concrete agreement on how to deal with what Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance called a new reality in Rhodesia.

title: Alexander's Seeks Sites Others Quit
description: Alexander's Inc., which began with two stores in the Bronx more than four decades ago, is planning to expand into highvolume, lowincome areas of Queens and Brooklyn, occupying sites of stores that have abandoned those markets.

title: Design Notebook
description: Ada Louise Huxtable

title: New Sheets Cover All Types of Dreamers
description: THIS week, as linens manufacturers presented their new collections here, buyers chose the bed fashions that will appear in the stores come September.

title: U.S. Softball Squad Stirs China Curiosity
description: The Connecticut Falcons, International Women's Professional League softball champions, have been touring China since May 17. The following is an excerpt from a journal kept by the team's codirectors, Joan Joyce and Fran D'Angelo.

title: 12 Colleges, 5 in New York Area, Get $10,000 Prizes for Innovation
description: The efforts of a dozen colleges and universities that have tried to serve special needs in higher education were recognized last night by the Academy for Educational Development in a ceremony at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel.

title: Letters
description: Keep the Children Home

title: C.I.A. Sees Lag In China Steel
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters) China will remain a big steel importer well into the 1980's because of insuffi cient domestic production, the Central Intelligence Agency said today.

title: ECEVIT CALLED IRATE ON SPYFLIGHT PLEA
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 23  Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit is furious at what he feels are efforts by Washington to put pressure on him to accept U2 flights over Turkey to monitor missile tests in the Soviet Union, according to high Turkish officials.

title: 2.47 Inches of Rain Sets New Record for May 23
description: Yesterday's rain set a record for the 23d of May in New York City, a modest one perhaps, but a record nonetheless.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: By Reuters

title: Thais and Communists Fight
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 23 (UPI) A fourday battle with Communist insurgents in Thailand ended today when Government forces seized three Communist guerrilla camps after a fourday battle with what was estimated to be a 200man force. The camps were empty. The battle started when a 60man Thai patrol was ambushed Sunday in the Phupan Mountains. 350 miles northeast of Banekok.

title: New Jersey
description: NEWARK, May 23  Holiday travelers headed for the shore and lake resorts of New Jersey can expect to find added bus and rail service to ease their trip, but motorists are likely to find the going rougher.

title: Personal Drama for Trudeau
description: OTTAWA, May 23  The defeat of Pierre Elliott Trudeau's party in yesterday's election was as much a personal drama as one of the most notable political events in Canada in recent times. The country's bestknown contribution to the roster of world statesmen was best known at home for his identification with a goal, one that he did not reach and that now appears more elusive than ever.

title: 3 Reds Homers Top Giants
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 23 (AP) Cincinnati's Mike LaCoss pitched a threehitter and the Reds smacked three homers tonight to beat the San Francisco Giants, 50.

title: MINCHEW SAYS LIE MADE HIM ACCUSER
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Daniel Minchew said today that he had once been willing to take a fall for Senator Herman E. Talmadge to save his former employer from charges of financial wrongdoing. But he said that Mr. Talmadge had lied to him about plans for a coverup and that he therefore became the Georgia Democrat's chief accuser.

title: DR. MATTHEW R. FURMAN
description: Dr. Matthew R. Furman, a New York City physician for half a century, died Tuesday in Stratford, Conn., after a long illness. He was 77 years old and had lived in New York City all his life.

title: About Bethel
description: BETHEL, Cohn., May 22  The executives in the corporate swim have their houses set like aquariums on shaved hills and peeled meadows where farmers used to work and wonder before the picture window was invented.

title: Stage: Private Lives
description: NOEL COWARD wrote his comedy Private Lives in 1930, when Queens was still a trip to the country. He prob

title: MidMay Auto Sales Off Sharply
description: DETROIT, May 23 (AP)  Auto sales by United States manufacturers dropped sharply in the middle of May, with deliveries by the Big Three producers down 25.7 percent in the 10day selling period.

title: AN AYATOLLAH SAYS HE QUITS AS A JUDGE
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 23  Ayatollah Sadegh Khalkhali, whose call for the assassination of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi caused an international incident, abruptly and without explanation, announced his resignation today as a religious judge of the Revolutionary Courts.

title: Upstate New York
description: ALBANY, May 23  A spot check of upstate resorts showed that holiday motorists will find service stations in the cities closing earlier and on weekends, while those in resort areas will be open on weekends although closing earlier in the day and on midweek days.

title: Raises for Top Officials Opposed at City Hearing
description: New Yorkers supporting themselves on fixed incomes, living or working in poverty areas or just disenchanted with city government spoke out at a public hearing yesterday against raising the salaries of the city's elected officials.

title: Brezhnev Now Expected To Go to Vienna by Air
description: VIENNA, May 23 (UPI)  Austrian officials said today that Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, planned to travel to Vienna by air for his meeting with President Carter next month.

title: Boy, 15, Who Set Fire to Woman Committed to Mental Institution
description: A 15yearold boy who had set fire to shoppingbag lady was transferred yesterday to a state mentalhealth institution where he could spend from one to 10 years undergoing psychiatric treatment.

title: Gas Inventories Drop in Week
description: The nation's gasoline inventories dropped by three million barrels to 224.9 million barrels in the week ended May 18, according to the American Petroleum Institute.

title: Silverman to Introduce Shows on Mature Level
description: Fred Silverman, president of the National Broadcasting Company, yesterday revealed some of the programs in development that will figure importantly in his effort to revitalize NBCTV and move it from third place in the audiencepopularity ratings to a leadership position by Christmas of 1980.

title: Lebanese Say Dispute Over Ties With Israel Delays Coalition Rule
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 23  Leaders of Parliament here said today that differences over Lebanese relations with Israel were holding up formation of a political coalition to replace the Cabinet of nonpolitical economic and administrative specialists that resigned last week

title: ement Makers: Bigger Fewer?
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  During most of his business life, James E. Stewart, chairman and chief executive officer of Lone Star Industries, was busy expanding a buildingsupplies store in Minneapolis into a nationwide chain. In the last year he has spent most of his time selling off the operation, which Lone Star acquired for $30 million in 1971. It has not been an easy step for Mr. Stewart, who two years after the acquisition became chairman of Lone Star, the nation's largest cement manufacturer.

title: LowTech Storage: Packing Boxes
description: THE walls are grimy, the paint is chipped, the floor is dirty, the calendar is out of date and the storage wall is bulging. That's exactly what I had in mind, said Peter M. Fine, a photographer, who had worked hard to get the entrance to his loft to look rundown, dingy and decrepit. Mr. Fine said he wanted part of the interior of the warehouse building to be in keeping with the neighborhood and the look of the building's exterior.

title: New York Lists 25 Auto Insurers With Most Customer Complaints
description: The New York State Insurance Department yesterday released its annual list of the 25 automobile insurers with the most customer complaints per dollars of premiums written. Heading the list was the Nassau Insurance Company with a total of 735 complaints. The others, in descending order were:

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  As Israel and Egypt begin negotiations this weekend on the degree of autonomy to be given Palestinian Arabs, the central question is this: To whom does the West Bank belong?

title: Ballet: BreuerGregory Swan Lake
description: THERE was a recent time in ballet when a partner was there primarily to show off the ballerina. It was the attitude that many of Margot Fonteyn's English partners displayed, and it was one that gave us the age of the ballerina with Galina Ulanova and Maya Plisetskaya.

title: Workers at United Airlines Apparently Ratify Pact
description: A contract that would settle the 54dayold strike of United Airlines has apparently been ratified by members of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers.

title: Stiff Upper Lips, Slightly Wilted Flowers
description: LONDON

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Students Riot in Nepal In BhuttoRelated Conflict
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 23 (AP)  Hundreds of students set fire to a Governmentowned newspaper office, a gas station and vehicles today. The police fired tear gas at them but they did not flee.

title: In 2 Italian Cities, Diverse Politics but Shared Pragmatism
description: LUCCA, Italy, May 19  Siena and Lucca are like twins, ancient cities 40 miles apart in Tuscany, the heart of Italy.

title: Door of Airliner Fails, Man Falls to His Death
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 23 (AP) An emergency door on an airliner popped open today and a passenger was sucked out to his death 6,000 feet below, the Civil Aeronautics Administration said.

title: Tight Gasoline Supplies Predicted For ThreeDay Holiday Weekend
description: Motorists in New York City and a good part of the country will find most gasoline service stations closed this Memorial Day weekend and fuel purchases limited at those that are open. Many of the open stations will have no supplies of unleaded fuel.

title: Indians 4, Blue Jays 3
description: TORONTO, May 23 (AP)  Wayne Garland pitched a fourhitter for his first complete game since 1977 and Gary Alexander cracked a tworun homer in the eighth as the Cleveland Indians rallied to beat the Toronto Blue Jays, 43, tonight.

title: Carter Bill On Trucks Due in June
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Administration officials said today that they would submit by midJune a longawaited bill designed to ease entry and promote price competition in trucking.

title: Spinks's Brother Charged With Attempted Robbery
description: ST. LOUIS, May 23 (UPI)  Kenneth Spinks, the I9yearold brother of Leon Spinks, the former heavyweight boxing champion, was charged in warrants issued today with attempted robbery and tampering with an auto.

title: Former Arms Treaty Negotiator Assails Planned Pact With Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)  A forme; director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency criticized the proposed stratgegic arms limitation treaty with the Soviet Union today, saying it would lead to a dangerous negotiating deadlock with Moscow in the 1980's.

title: Calendar of Events: Brooklyn Houses
description: House Tour, Sixth Street, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, Brooklyn.

title: Deaths
description: BALSAMAdam. We express our sincere condolences to our colleague Howard Balsam and his wife Rhoda and family at the loss of their son Adam.

title: Rangers 7, Twins 2
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., May 23 (AP) Al Oliver smashed three homers, driving in four runs, and Ferguson Jenkins allowed six hits as the Texas Rangers defeated the Minnesota Twins, 72, tonight.

title: Books: Rising Above the Crises of Life
description: SOLDIER, SAGE, SAINT. By Robert C. Neville. 131 pages. Fordharn University Press. $7.50.

title: Ballet: Bournonville
description: ALTHOUGH the New York City Ballet has produced several idiosyncratic versions of old ballets, the only extended pieces of authentic 19thcentury choreography it dances are the Boumonville Divertissements, which received their first performance of the season Tuesday night at the New York State Theater.

title: Dodgers 4, Padres 2
description: SAN DIEGO, May 23 (AP)  Steve Garvey drove in a pair of runs with a double and Burt Hooton won his fourth straight game, allowing six hits, as the Los Angeles Dodgers downed the San Diego Padres, 42, tonight.

title: Albany Leaders Hear Koch Plea On Civil Service
description: ALBANY, May 23  Mayor Koch flew to Albany this morning to make a personal appeal for his proposals for Civil Service revisions and to oppose an extension of the heart bill, which enables policemen and firemen to retire with a pension if they develop a heart ailment on or off the job.

title: 2 Subpoenaed in Terrorist's Escape
description: A lawyer and a halfbrother of William Morales, the reputed Puerto Rican terrorist who fled from a prison ward at Bellevue Hospital on Monday, have been subpoenaed by a Federal grand jury investigating the escape.

title: Brooklyn Lawyer Convicted
description: Edward Stahl, a lawyer from Atlantic Beach, L.I., with offices at 26 Court Street in Brooklyn, was convicted yesterday of two counts of criminal contempt in State Supreme Court in Manhattan. He was acquitted of two other counts of criminal contempt in a jury trial before Acting Justice Harold J. Rothwax. Mr. Stahl was accused of lying to a grand jury investigating corruption in the Civil Term of State Supreme Court in Manhattan. He faces a maximum of four years in prison when he is sentenced on July 16.

title: TOP POP RECORDS
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World. a trade Publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from mine retail outlets. singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially lastselling record.

title: Hoover Directors Back Stock Purchase
description: Directors of the Hoover Company, meeting in Canton, Ohio, voted to authorize the purchase, for up to $22 a share, of the 1.1 million shares owned by Herbert W. Hoover Jr. and other family members.

title: Robert G. Trott Is Dead; Longtime CARE Official
description: Robert G. Trott, the director in Kenya for CARE, the international aid and development organization, died Tuesday at Lenox Hill Hospital, after a long illness. He was 55 years old and lived in Kenya.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the world's great team championships celebrates its golden anniversary next week. The Reisinger Teams, which has been won by most of the country's greatest players in its 50year history, will begin .Monday at the Statler Hilton Hotel, following the conclusion of the Eastern Regionals, beginning in the same place tomorrow.

title: Deltona Expects Extraordinary Gain
description: Frank E. Mackle Jr., president of the Deltona Corporation, told the annual meeting in New York that the company expects to report an extraordinary gain in the second quarter of $8.5 million, or $2.15 a share, from the sale of the Marco Beach Hotel and Villas in Florida for $35 million. He said proceeds of the sale had been used to reduce the company's debt.

title: U.S. Says New Missile Is Not Yet Deployed By Soviet in Germany
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  The White House said today that the Soviet Union has not yet deployed a new, nucleararmed missile in East Germany, despite earlier reports that it had.

title: Stolen Czanne Works Recovered
description: CHICAGO, May 23  Three paintings by Paul Czanne, stolen from the Art Institute of Chicago late last year, were recovered here today and a former employee of the museum was arrested after he walked into a busy hotel carrying the paintings in a plastic garbage bag and sought to collect a $250,000 ransom, the authorities said.

title: Disks: Ruth Laredo
description: RACHMANINOFF, The Complete Works for Solo Piano, Vol. V: Variations on a Theme by Chopin; Transcriptions Bach Suite (Preludio, Gavotte, Gigue); Minuet from Bizet's L'Arlesienne Suite No. 1; RimskyKorsakov's The Bumblebee; Schubert's The Brooklet (Wohin?); Scherzo from Mendelssohn's A Midsummer Night's Dream; Tchaikovsky's Lullaby, and Ropak from Mussorgsky's The Fair at Sorochinsk. Ruth Laredo, piano. (Columbia M35151).

description: A Decorating Coup

title: Settlement Is Due In Martin Lawsuit
description: Billy Martin, the former and perhaps future manager of the Yankees, and Ray Hagar, a Nevada sportswriter, are expected to announce an outofcourt settlement of Hagar's lawsuit on assault charges against Martin at a news conference in Reno today.

title: Pop: Margery Cohen
description: MARGERY COHEN, a dark haired singer with a radiant air who has seemingly made a specialty of appearing in Off Broadway productions celebrating popular composers (Cole Porter, Kurt Weill, Leonard Bernstein, Jacques Brel, Richard Maltby Jr. and David Shire), is now celebrating herself in At Home with Margery Cohen, a program of songs that will be at the Manhattan Theater Club, 321 East 73d Street. through Sunday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Controlling Handguns
description: CHICAGO  Every year, 250,000 citizens face a handgun. For over 9,000, it is the last moment of their lives. This mayhem could be minimized if we applied businesslike procedures to the manufacture, sale and transfer of these concealable death weapons. Industry has learned to account for potentially dangerous products in the public interest, and in its own interests. For example, automobile manufacturers keep records of customers in case modification or recall is required. And the law requires legal transfer of automobile ownership. Why not equally sensible rules for handguns?

title: Bronx Zoo Seeks $20 lelion for Future
description: With a bull sea lion bellowing as if in endorsement, the New York Zoological Society announced plans yesterday for a new children's zoo within the Bronx Zoo, a 1,000seat whaleanddolphin stadium at the New York Aquariumand a series of large indoor habitats for Wild Asia tropical animals.

title: Killer Bees Head North
description: Let it not be thought that the adventures of the killer bees in the Texas State Senate represent an isolated instance of legislative irresponsibility. There's a strange buzz over Washington, too; the House Democratic caucus has voted, by a 2to1 margin, to oppose an energy measure it is powerless to stop.

title: White Sox 6, A's 1
description: CHICAGO, May 23 (AP)  Chet Lemon's tiebreaking threerun homer capped a fourrun fifth inning tonight that carried Ken Kravec to his fourth consecutive victory as the Chicago White Sex defeated the Oakland A's, 61.

title: Body of an Idaho State Senator Found in Wreckage of Helicopter
description: CLARKIA, Idaho, May 23 (UPI)  The bodies of State Senator Gerald Blackbird of Idaho and two other men were found late today amid the wreckage of their heliconter.

title: It's Hartford Whalers
description: HARTFORD, May 23 AP)  The New England Whalers are not only joining a new league, but also getting a new name. On entering the National Hockey League for the 197980 season, the former World Hockey Association franchise will be known as the Hartford Whalers.

title: Vernon Brown, 72, Trombonist With Shaw, Goodman, Spanier
description: Vernon Brown, a trombonist who played with Artie Shaw, Benny Goodman and Muggsy Spanier, died in Los Angeles last Saturday. He was 72 years old and lived in Roslyn Heights, L.I.

title: F.T.C. Studies Movie Exports
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23  The Federal Trade Commission's regional office here has begun an investigation of possible anticompetitive practices by major motion picture companies. it announced today.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Rock Island Line Strike Averted As Pay Issue Goes to Mediators
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)  Union and management negotiators with the Rock Island & Pacific Railroad have reached agreement to submit a dispute over back pay to a special panel, averting a strike that would have affected freight shipments in 13 states.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets continued to rise yesterday for the third consecutive day, but the upward move was less pronounced than on Tuesday and Wednesday. Taxexempt bond prices completed their biggest weekly advance in four months.

title: Millard L. Midonick Weds Jill N. Claster
description: Jill Nadell Claster, dean of the College of Arts and Sciences and associate professor of history at New York University, was married yesterday to Surrogate Millard Lesser Midonick. The ceremony was performed at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Julius Korein by Justice Arthur Markewich of the Appellate Division, State Supreme Court.

title: PARKING REGULATIONS
description: Alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations are in effect today only in the Bronx as part of the boroughbyborough effort to clean up refuse in the streets that has accumulated in the tubeat strike.

title: ProKennedy Bloc in Florida Seeks To Humiliate Carter in Straw Vote
description: MIAMI, May 23  More than three years after a straw vote at the Florida Democratic convention helped to lift Jimmy Carter from political obscurity, the leaders of a movement to draft Senator Edward M. Kennedy have hatched a plan to use this year's straw poll to humiliate the President politically.

title: Radiation Report to Be Revised After Dispute Over Cancer Risks
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)  A National Academy of Sciences committee has decided to rewrite part of a major study of lowlevel radiation because dissenting members feel that potential cancer risks were overstated.

title: Soviet and U.S. Agree on Agenda For BrezhnevCarter Conference
description: WASHINGTON, May 24  The United States and the Soviet Union have agreed oh an agenda and a detailed schedule for the conference between President Carter and Leonid I. Brezhnev in Vienna next month, White House officials said today.

title: Obituary 8 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION..IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:30 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900, WESTCHESTER CO AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 747050; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487757.

title: GOV. GRASSO PLANS GASPRICE PROGRAM
description: HARTFORD, May 24  State officials will take over from the Federal Govern- ment responsibility for enforcing regulations on gasoline prices, beginning in the next two weeks, Gov. Ella T. Grasso said today.

title: Market Place
description: ALEGAL dispute has emerged over the acquisition by Cargill Inc. of the MBPXL Corporation that could have wide ramifications for companies involved in mergers and acquisitions. The direc- tors of MBP had signed a prior contract late last year to sell to ConAgra Inc., a diversified Nebraskabased food processor with sales of $600 million a year. MBP, with headquarters in Wichita, Kan., is the nation's secondlargest beef processor (after Iowa Beef Processors).

title: 2 Radio Stations Seeking Funds to Pay Moe's Fine
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., May 24 (AP)  Two local radio stations have started a drive to collect $3,000 to pay the fine imposed yesterday on Doug Moe, the San Antonio Spurs coach, for criticizing National Basketball Association referees.

title: Rock: Patti Smith Sings
description: WHEN Patti Smith first appeared as a rockandroller, her admirers wondered how she could possibly sustain the inspirational level of her performances in the cruelly repetitive world of live performances and tours.

title: Zachry Beats Cubs, 42, After Mets Lose, 97
description: A couple of highlevel pitching auditions were held in the relative privacy of Shea Stadium last night as the New York Mets divided a doubleheader with the Chicago Cubs but regained the right arm of Pat Zachry.

title: Southern Yemen Blends Marxism With Islam and Arab Nationalism
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, May 20  Nowhere else in the Arab world has the Soviet bloc penetrated so thoroughly into almost every domain, from politics and national security to education and eco nomic development, as it has in Southern Yemen.

title: Derwent Awards Made
description: Laurie Kennedy and Richard Cox have been named winners of the 35th annual Clarence Derwent Awards for the 197879 season.

title: Bridge:
description: The most famous regional tournament in North America, with a tradition stretching back to the earliest days of contract bridge, begins today at the Statler Hilton Hotel. It is the Eastern Regional Championships, and the following events are scheduled:

title: Deaths
description: SOBERSamuel, MD. Beloved husband of Bernice (Beerman). Devoted father of the James and Fay and the late Richard. Dear brother of Pincus, Meyer, Rose, Harry and Sidney. Funeral Sunday, May 27 at 2:30PM at Frank E. Campbell 81st & Madison.

title: Art: Met Displays Its Italian Masters
description: OLD master drawings guard the integrity of art. Where almost everything else can be cheapened and travestied, Old master draWings keep their own counsel. To enjoy them calls for a trained memory, a certain familiarity with the Bible and with the Greek and Latin classics, and the kind of concentrated attention that we associate with the hermit in his cell.

title: DENG, UNDER ATTACK, HITS BACK IN CHINA
description: HONG KONG, May 24  China's senior Deputy Prime Minister, Deng Xiaoping, apparently under. criticism in recent weeks for the troublesome wall poster movement and other difficulties, has launche a vigorous counterattack.

title: Stage: Bonjour, l, Bonjour
description: HARTFORD  In Bonjour, l, Bonjour by the FrenchCanadian playwright Michel Tremblay, the family is seen as an ingrown, mutually contaminating organism. On the surface, this bitter yet lyrically written play, now running at the Hartford Stage Company, deals with incest, but that is only the most shocking demonstration of a large family at war with itself.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: ROBERT FRANK

title: Congress Asks Proof Oil Is Short
description: WASHINGTON, May 24  Members of the Senate and House of Representatives of widely diverse political viewpoints urged President Carter today to prove to the nation that there really was a shortage of gasoline and oil, not just an illusion caused by the Administration and the oil companies.

title: $1.5 Million Theft
description: DETROIT, May 24 (AP)  Fred Dixon, a 28yearold Purolator security guard who admitted taking more than $1.5 million, has been fined $1,000 and sentenced to weekends in jail for two months. Judge Julian Cook Jr. of Federal District Court also gave Mr. Dixon a suspended fouryear prison term. All of the stolen money was recovered.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: The union of love, vanity, confused identities and feudal power that come together in Mozart's The Marriage of Figaro will be reenacted this weekend at the State University of New York at Purchase. This production of the opera sung in English  is being presented by the school's music division in Theater C of the Performing Arts Center. Patricia Brooks, who has sung several leading roles with the New York City Opera, is directing. Performances tonight, tomorrow and Sunday at 8 P.M. Tickets are $3 ($2 for students). Reservations are a must. Call (914) 2535900. From New York, take the Hutchinson River Parkway to exit 28 (Lincoin Avenue); turn left at the second light and right at Anderson Hill Road.

title: TV Weekend
description: TWO of the weekend's more ambitious television movies are running against each other on Sunday at 9 P.M. The Best Place to Be is on NBC, Dummy on CBS.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. Disarmament Commission  10:30 A.M.

title: Music: Pro Arte Strings
description: A PLEASANT concert of music for strings was given at Alice Tully Ball on Wednesday night by the New York Pro Arte Chamber Orchestra under the direction of Raffael Adler. The Program ranges from Handel's Concerto Grosso in B minor (Op. 6, No. 12) and Mozart's Adagio and Fugue (K. 546) to Alec Wilder's Suite for French Horn and Strings by way of Grieg's Holberg Suite, Roussel's Sinfonietta (Op. 52) and Lester Trimble's transcription of the Fugue in C sharp minor from Bach's WellTempered Clavier. Robert Routch was the soloist in Wilder's Suite, which was given its first New York performance.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday. May 24, 1979

title: Key Panel, I78, Votes to Prevent Public Financing for House Races
description: WASHINGTON, May 24  The House Administration Committee dealt a serious, perhaps fatal, blow today to the proposal for public financing of House elec. tions, voting 17 to 8 to kill the bill.

title: Dow Gains Slightly In Desultory Market
description: Wall Street's spotlight focused yesterday on the takeover sector as the Interway Corporation and Reliance Electile scored the biggest gains on the active list of the New York Stock Exchange. The overall market showed little change as the Dow Jones industrial average edged up 0.26 to 837.66.

title: Vance Asks Halt in Sale of 747's To Libya because of Uganda Role
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI)  Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance has urged canceling the sale of three Boeing 747's to Libya because of its intervention in Uganda, the State Department said today.

title: Maine Woods Alert: Spray Planes Coming
description: WYTOPITLOCK, Me., May 24 Like a lot of people here in Maine's vast north woods, Rita Potter has not yet decided whether to leave before the spray planes come.

title: Guidelines Are a Failure, Labor Leader Charges
description: A top official of organized labor said yesterday that the Administration's wageprice guidelines were jeopardizing collective bargaining and had so far failed to control inflation.

title: The City
description: The parents of a Barnard College freshman who died last week after she was hit by a chunk of concrete that fell from a building owned by Columbia University said that the university killed their daughter through its negligence and that they planned to take court action.

title: Federal Judge Rebuffs Challenge To U.S. Generic Listing of Drugs
description: BALTIMORE, May 24 (AP)  A Federal judge here has dismissed a challenge by the pharmaceutical industry to the Government's promotion of generic names for drugs.

title: CarRental Concerns Gid to Meet Demand On Holiday Weekend
description: Rental cars with full tanks of gasoline are expected to be available in the New York metropolitan area on the Memorial Day weekend, according to major carrental companies.

title: U.S. Manpower Program: Blacks Voicing Uneasiness
description: As it pushes its stringent budget through Congress, the Carter Administration is trying to stress its achievements and its intentions on manpower to blacks and others who hoped for higher domestic spending.

title: Pumps Registering $1 Cheer Gasoline Dealer
description: Earl Murray is a man with 10 brandnew gasoline pumps  and that, he says, makes him one happy man.

title: Rugby Match Set In Lincroft, N.J.
description: The second in a series of four rugby matches will pit the Metropolitan New York All Star Team against Tredegar of Wales, tomorrow at 2 P.M. at Thompson Park, Route 520 (Newman Springs Road) Lincroft, N.J. The amateur competition will be held rain or shine. Future games will be played on May 29 and June 9. Admission is free. Information: 7525282 or (201) 8424000.

title: Director of Science News Appointed by The Times
description: William Stockton has been appointed director of science news for The New York Times, it was announced yesterday by A. M. Rosenthal, executive editor of the paper. Mr. Stockton will have responsibility for daily science coverage and the Science Times section on Tuesdays.

title: FosterCare Plan Seeks To Keep Children Home
description: ALBANY,. May 24  Responding to years of criticism that New York State is warehousing children in foster care, key legislators and Governor Carey announced agreement today on major legislative changes that would create financial incentives to keep children at home.

title: Bulgarian Sets Lift Mark
description: VARNA, Bulgaria, May 24 (AP)  Blagoi Blagoev of Bulgaria set a world record in the snatch event in the lightheavyweight category today in the European weightlifting championships. Blagoev snatched 379.5 pounds, bettcring the previous world record of 376.2 held by Yurik Vardanyan of the Soviet Union.

title: Events and Openings
description: ALIEN, directed by Ridley Scott; stars Torn Skerritt and Yaohet Kotto; at the Criterion, Loews Orpheum and Loews New York Twin theaters.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: ART (GR 37014)

title: Koch Budget Called Threat to Schools
description: School officials testified yesterday that Mayor Koch's proposed 1980 budget would require the New York City public schools to lay off 3,000 workers, fourfifths of them teachers.

title: Notes on People
description: Although the New York Rangers went down to inglorious defeat against the Montreal Canadiens in the Stanley Cup playoffs, they had a superb season that got them into the championships, and that's good enough to earn them a key to the city, Mayor Koch said yesterday.

title: For Children
description: GO FLY A COLONIAL KITE, a kitemaking no worshop for children, 7 and older. with Caleb Crowell, who will talk about kitemaking In the 18th century. Monday. 10:30 A.M. and 12:30 P.M., at the Abigail Adams Smith Museum, 421 East 61st Street. Fee, S3 per person, includes materials. Tickets and Information: 8365489.

title: Topics
description: Senator Hayakawa of California, a famous semanticist, has been having more than his share of language problems lately. Last week, the Republican Senator suggested that the solution to the gasoline crisis is higher prices  perhaps $2 or $3 a gallon. At such prices, only the welltodo could afford to fill their tanks, which is all right with Senator Hayakawa: The poor don't need gas because they are not working.

title: State Panel Told Indian Pt. Plant Must Be Closed
description: ALBANY, May 24  A former Federal nuclearsafety engineer told a State Assembly committee today that the nuclearpower plants at Indian Point, about 35 miles north of New York City, should be closed immediately.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company announced a $200 million expansion program yesterday for the manufacture of its Kevlar aramid fibers that includes increasing capacity at its Richmond facilities and construction of a new plant in Louisiana.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: American Standard Inc., an international manufacturer of diversified products, has named Nicholas M. Georgitsis vice president of worldwide automotive products.

title: Dance: Japanese Themes
description: SNOW fell. Ghosts prowled. Gods came to earth. A widow mourned. Strange, solemn things happened in the dances presented by Saeko Ichinohe and Company Wednesday night at Japan House.

title: Bronx Shantytown Keeps Hounds for City's Hunters
description: Behind barbed wire and no-trespassing signs, next to a junkyard, in a valley hard by the Harlem River in the Bronk, is a compound of shacks that looks like a Depression shantytown.

title: 2 Observances of Memorial Day Causing Confusion in New York
description: New York and seven other states observe Memorial Day on the traditional date of May 30, rather than the Federal holiday, the last Monday of the Month.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A college that received a cash award of $10,000 from the Academy for Educational Development was incorrectly identified in Metropolitan Report yesterday. The College of Human Services was honored for a program of professional development for the disadvantaged.

title: Strauss Says He Is Willing to Run Against Chancellor Schmidt in '80
description: BONN, May 24  Franz Josef Strauss, the conservative Premier of Bavaria, made clear today that he was available to serve as Chancellor of West Germany and exposed to public view a struggle for the leadership of the conservative opposition parties in preparation for national elections next year.

title: Posner Buying
description: Victor Posner, the controversial, takeoverprone Miami investor, is on a buying spree. He has touched off widespread guessing as to when, or where, he intends to pounce.

title: Nine Honorary Degrees Are Awarded by Rutgers
description: Speaking yesterday at the 213th commencement exercises of Rutgers University, Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the school's president, urged students to work for racial equality. The exercises were held at the Rutgers Athletic Center on the Livingston College Campus in Piscataway, N.J. About 8,000 undergraduate and graduate degrees were conferred.

title: A Walk Through Chelsea's Literary Past
