title: Big 3: Strengths and Weaknesses
description: Hoechst A.G., outside of Frankfurt, was founded in 1862. It has grown into the largest chemical company in the world with pharmaceuticals, fibers and plastics making up about 35 percent of its sales.

title: After a Year, Atlantic City's Boom Eludes the Poor
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 26  Resorts International, which has been taking $600,000 a day from gamblers since opening New Jersey's first casino a year ago, celebrated the anniversary this weekend with straw hats, orange and white Happy Birthday banners and searchlights piercing the fog. or bus ride of the millions of residents of the New York and Philadelphia metropolitan areas has lifted Atlantic City from near bankruptcy to what a Chamber of Commerce spokesman called America's first success story in 50 years in rebuilding a city without Federal aid. And the boom is onlybeginning.

description: Chester Weit'who had been a reporter with the King Features Synditate for 40 years, died Saturday at the Sotindview Convalescent Home in West Haven, Conn. He was 88 vears old.

The ceremony was held at the Band'i Cabin in Teaneck, N.J.

title: NO VENDETTAS SEEN AGAINST IRAN'S JEWS
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 27  An undercurrent of fear haunts Iran's Jewish community, but there is no evidence to suggest that the Islamic revolution has spurred either official or unofficial vendettas aaainst Jews.

title: I.T.T. Sells 25% Of Argentine Unit
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation announced the sale of 25 percent of the common stock of its Argentine subsidiary, Comparlia Standard Electric Argentina, to Argentine investors for about $7.5 million. The Buenos Airesbased company is leading manufacturer of telecommunications equipment in South America.

title: Ketch Takes Block Island Race.
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 27  Inverness, the 68foot ketch that has been one of the faster offshore racing yachts of this decade, found wind and tides to her liking and trounced 61.competitors in the Storm Trysail Club's annual Block Island Race that ended here today.

title: 2 Los Angeles Teams; Arena Said to Be Sold In a $68 Million Deal
description: In what could be the largest single financial transaction in the history of professional sports, the Los Angeles Lakers basketball team, Los Angeles Kings hockey team and The Forum arena in Inglewood, Calif., have been sold for about $68 million, a source close to the negotiations said yesterday.

description: DENVER, May 27  The twoyearlong strike by brewery workers against the Adolph Coors Company is over and the union lost, but the boycott of Coors beer is dragging on.

The wall collapsed at 5 P.M. and fell forward toward two Claremont Avenue buildingsat 189 and 191.

description: LOS ANGELES, May 27  Five years bbfore the 1989 Summer blyrnpic Games are scheduled to be held in Los Angeles, the games have already touched off charges of OffiCial deception and cost overruns.

title: Toyota Sees Oil Threat To Japan
description: TOYOTA CITY, Japan, May 23 The rapid rise of international oil prices threatens to slow Japanese economic growth to far less than the current Government estimate of 6.3 percent in the fiscal year that began April 1, according to economists of the Toyota Motor COMpany here.

title: The Region
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate Armed Services Committee has authorized procurement in 1980 of six ME attack and lightbomber aircraft built by the Grumman Aerospace Corporation of Bethpage, L.I., for the Navy. The planes would cost an estimated ISO million.

description: The nation's shortage of crude oil, which has left many drivers and Surfacetransportation systems starved for fuel, is barely affecting service on America's airlines.

title: Renaldo Nehemiah: Always in Control
description: IT was to be a routine baton pass. Sprinters practice the exchange daily. But Greg Robertson's shoe caught the back of Renaldo Nehemiah's leg, and Nehemiah lost his balance, fell and skidded on the hard allweather track at Byrd Stadium. stuaent sunbathers, who normally stir only to slap on more oil or change rock tunes on their portable radios, sat up in the east stands, startled. Frank Costello, the University of Maryland track coach, let out a frightened gasp, as if a Dresden figurine had fallen from a mantel.

title: Patricia Sbendelman Married To Rabbi Frederic Margulies

title: The Night the Bugs Took Over
description: SOMETIMES it seems that the New York Mets and their customers and the newspaper stiffs who cover their games enjoy less than perfect rapport, but they do have one thing in common: They are all too young, their memories are too short. Otherwise they would not have regarded it as a phenomenon when a game with the Pittsburgh Pirates was fogged out in Shea Stadium the other night.

title: Weekend on a Turnpike: Easy Driving
description: Out of Allegheny County, bucking westward wind, a rental car with a full tank and clicking tappets goes almost alone at 1,200 feet above sea level. description: In, an effort, to learn more about the charges being made about herbicides, esPecially Agent Orange and 2,4,5T, The New,York Times interviewed 18 veterans and 10 civilians from nine states.

title: Harvard Will Not Name Library For Donor Linked to South Africa

title: TV: How Israelis Captured Eichmann
description: THE House on Garibaldi Street, an ABC Theater presentation that can be seen tonight at 9, is the story of the capture of Adolf Eichmann, the Nazi war criminal, in Buenos Aires in 1960. The script is adapted from a book by Isser Harel, head of Israel's Secret Service at the time. As usual, certain incidents and characters have been changed for dramatic purposes.

title: Ilene Beth Rosen Married on L.I. to Lawrence A. Cohen
description: Flene Beth Rosen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Rosen of Lawrence, L.I., was married yesterday at the Sephardic Temple in Cedarhurst, L.I., to Lawrence Alan Cohen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irwin Cohen of North Woodmere, L.I. Rabbi Gilbert Klaperman performed the ceremony.

title: JapaneseAmericans Recall Wartime Camps
description: TULELAKE, Calif., May 27 (UPI) About 400 JapaneseAmericans dedicated a plaque today at one of 10 American concentration camps used during World War 11.

title: For the Size 14 Woman, Stylish Clothes and Modeling Contracts

Their professions included real estate, show business and marine plastics. Their dress sizes ranged from 14 to 20. They were members of the Other Dimensions model agency.

title: Russia Reported Selling U.S. Rhodesian Chrome
description: LONDON, May 27 (AP)  The Soviet Union has been buying Rhodesian chrome in defiance of United Nations sanctions and reselling some of it to the United States at almost twice the price, The London Sunday Telegraph reported today.

title: Black Conferees Establish Network To Influence White Congressmen
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., May 27  The Congressional Black Caucus and delegates from 11 Southern states established an action alert communications network here this weekend that they hope will help them to exert pressure on at least 100 white Congressional representatives from heavily black districts to vote with the 17member caucus on important issues.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: LITERATURE is a house in which V.S. Pritchett is very much at home. It is not a factory, cranking out metaphors and symbols; por a classroom, where unruly themes are made to sit at their little desks and, as Flannery O'Connor put it, chew the carpet to get at the figure; nor a laboratory, wherein refugees from deep French thought, wearing leather jackets instead of white smocks, concoct novels out of theories and stopper them, like brains in bottles of formaldehyde. It is a house whose agreeable wings are populated by writers of various nationalities and centuries, their mothers, fathers, wives and children, their biographers and critics, and even their characters, who are pets.

description: 5:55(4)Transformation

Schneeberg of Philadelphia, became the bride of Gerald Jay Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Robinson of Brooklyn. Rabbis Seymour Rosenbloom and Yaakov Rosenberg officiated. They were assisted by Cantor Charles Davidson.

title: Plenty of Gas For the Fans

Despite fears to the contrary, it appeared that the gas shortage put more of a crimp on the speed of the race cars than on the habits of the estimated 300,000 fans who braved their fears of a shortage and made it here to the 63d Indianapolis 500.

title: Key Sinai Town Adjusting to New Identity

Two days earlier. the last Israeli Army units piled into their vehicles and headed east down the same road, ending 12 years of occunation.

title: Many Veterans Ask Not Themselves For Whom Vietnam Tolled
description: CLEVELAND  President Carter has decreed today through June 3 as Vietnam Veterans Week. The ostensible purpose of his action is to recognize the efforts these men made during the Vietnam War. This public recognition is long overdue and may be too late to reverse the alienation, depression, guilt, anger, rage, shame and feelings of rejection that many of these forgotten soldiers have experienced since coming home from the war.

title: Taps From Lines Causirzg Utilities To Lose Millions
description: The Brooklyn Union Gas Company had twice discontinued service to two Brooklyn apartment buildings  in May 1975 and again in November 1976. But servicemen repeatedly found that new pipes had been installed to bring in gas illegally.

title: Visits to White House Are Above 1978 Levels
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI)  Despite President Carter's call for Americans to cut down on their travel, the crowds of tourists at the White House have been increasing, and totals are running ahead of last year.

title: 45Year Conrail Employee Fund Reported to Be Almost Depleted
description: BOSTON, May 27 (AP)  A $250 million Conrail employees fund that was expected to last 45 years is nearly depleted after three years, The Boston Herald American said in a copyrighted report today. The Governmentfinanced private corporation is prepared to ask Congress for an additional $1.5 billion to replenish the fund, the paper said.

title: Two ScottoCase Figures Survive Newark Assault

description: Courthouse, by Paul Hoffman (Hawthorn, $12.50). New York court and people who work in it.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 27  A solidly built 12story building with a bulletproof entrance a short walk from here at Lexington Avenue and 38th Street is being turned into the new headquarters of the Cuban delegation to the United Nations.

title: Officials Debate Airport Growth In Westchester

title: LEADERS SAY BORDER OF EGYPT AND ISRAEL IS NOW TO BE OPEN
description: BEERSHEBA, Israel, May 27  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel exchanged visits today and announced new steps, including the opening of borders between the two countries, to maintain progress toward better relations.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: A band of heavy cloudiness extends from the Middle Atlantic States to the Southern Plains States. A small area of broken clouds is scattered across Texas while a larger area of broken cloudiness covers the Pacific Northwest and southwestern Canada. Clear skies are apparent in the rest of the country.

title: Talks Resume in Tugboat Strike
description: Negotiations to and the 55day old strike by tugboat crews resumed for nearly six hours yesterday at the headquarters of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in the World Trade Center. A decision on continued negotiations was expected to be announced later this week. The Port Authority became involved in efforts to settle the walkout last week because of the economic impact of the strike on harbor commerce.

They wrote about their troubles with hospitals, Blue cross, credit card firms and the like. Some had thoughts about how to fight the machine.

title: Give Police a Chance, Rally Leader Urges Klansmen

Wizard of the Ku Klux Klan, called on about 75 fellow Klansmen rallying at City Hall here today to give the police a chance to complete an investigation of yesterday's shooting incident in which two Klansmen were among four persons wounded.

title: Linda Ruthe Kartoz Wed To Michael D. Doochin

Doochin, both of Nashville. The ceremony was performed in the St. Moritz Hotel by Rabbi David H. Panitz of Temple Emanuel of Paterson, N.J.

title: Iran Embassy Empties 4,000 Bottles of liquor

title: A Long Road Lies Ahead Before Legislature Quits
description: ALBANY. May 25  The addition and subtraction process that sums upthe Legislature has begun. Everyone is paring down his list of issues to face, and legislative leaders have even begun venturing guesses about a midJune recess. (This should send shudders through those who recall that in recent years they have predicted preMemorial Day and straggled out postJuly 4).

description: BUCK HILL FALLS, Pa., May 27  In a rare public display of sarcasm, bitterness and pique at his Supreme Court colleagues, Justice Thurgood Marshall attacked the Court today for affording insufficient protection to constitutional rights in two recent cases.
